title: Registered Nurse PT - Post Anesthesia Care Unit
description:
Registered Nurse, Post Anesthesia Care Unit

Temporary Part-Time Position; Rotating shifts

DESCRIPTION:

The RN is responsible for ensuring that practice and conduct meets legislative requirements and the standards of the profession as designed by the College of Nurses of Ontario. RNs’ practice will also comply with Kingston General Hospital’s policies and procedures.

Within this role the Registered Nurse is accountable for contributing to the delivery of the Kingston General Hospital strategy. As an employee, one must demonstrate an awareness of and be responsible for actively promoting and supporting patient and family centered engagement and care in all we do.

PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES & DUTIES:

The RN initiates and coordinates interprofessional team assessments and plans of care including physical, spiritual and psychosocial needs of patients across the continuum of care. Delivers care and provides care coordination for an assigned group of patients in an ambulatory and/or inpatient setting. Plans, organizes and establishes priorities based on individual patient’s needs and scheduled activities and adjusts priorities and activities in response to unanticipated events. Develops plans of care to achieve identified patient goals within the ambulatory and/or inpatient setting and including planning for transitions within and from the hospital setting. Provides teaching and learning experiences for both patient and family. Coordinates family communication, family meetings and conferences. Performs therapeutic measures as prescribed by members of the professional care team and as indicated by the nursing diagnosis. Maintains appropriate records of observation, nursing care administered and patient’s response. Communicates regularly with the interprofessional team members throughout the patient care experience. Assigns, teaches and supervises Patient Care Assistants/Volunteers. Acts as the key contact person for new interprofessional team members and assigned group of patients. Performs Charge Nurse responsibilities for a tour of duty as assigned. Provides for an environment which is conducive to the safety and well-being of patients, visitors and staff by practicing and promoting accident prevention; by being familiar with emergency procedures and regulations, by using skills, physical facilities, supplies and equipment safely and appropriately; and by being alert to infection hazards and infection control procedures. Maintains competence in nursing practice through in-service and continuing education. Participates in nursing research. Serves on departmental and related committees when and as requested. Interprets nursing department and hospital policies to patients, families and visitors. Performs related work as requested. Adheres to the worker responsibilities as set out in the Occupational Health & Safety Act, hospital safety policies and dept./unit established procedures at all times.

NOTE: The above duties are representative but are not to be construed as all inclusive. Please see People Services on Watkins 4 for the full Job Description.

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS:
Eligible for registration with the College of Nurses of Ontario.
Knowledge and competence in CPR.
Critical care experience is preferred; in the absence of critical care experience a minimum of 2 years in-patient surgical experience is required.
Previous perianesthesia nursing experience within the last three years preferred.
Previous paediatric nursing experience within the last three years preferred.
Demonstrated interpersonal and communication skills coupled with the ability to work on a multidisciplinary team an asset.
Proven ability to attend work regularly.
Satisfactory criminal reference check required.
PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS:

The physical demand will vary dependent on the specific unit or service. The incumbent will be required to meet the physical demands described for that unit of services.

We thank all applicants for their interest in this opportunity however only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Please Note: if you are a current KHSC- KGH site employee and wish to apply to this position please contact a member of the Recruitment team to obtain the link to apply.

TJX Companies, Inc.
Are you ready to explore career opportunities at TJX Canada and join our team? TJX Canada is part of The TJX Companies, Inc., the world’s leading off-price retailer of apparel and homeware worldwide, and in Canada, our retail chains include Winners, Marshalls and HomeSense.

In the retail business, we move fast. We’re always adapting, evolving and innovating. And the fast pace brings variety and challenge, along with many growth opportunities. We operate hundreds of stores in hundreds of cities.

TJX’s retail chains include TJ Maxx, Marshalls, HomeGoods and Sierra Trading Post in the United States TK Maxx in the United Kingdom, Ireland, Germany, Poland, Austria and the Netherlands, as well as HomeSense in the United Kingdom and Ireland; and TK Maxx in Australia.

As a retailer committed to growth, success is always in style at TJX!

Eloise is an Assistant Store Manager of Operations. She Oversees’ the efficient operation of the cash office, markdowns, human resources and scheduling functions. Assist’s in backroom processes, merchandising standards and presentation. Models TJX Canada values every day during daily interactions with Associates and Customers.

When Eloise first came on board, she said it was easy to embrace our organizational values because they mirrored her own. Eloise is genuine, engaging and approachable. She currently holds the top score for her department ping pong tournament team, you should see the celebration dance after a big win! Let’s just say she could be a professional break-dancer. If it weren’t for individuals like Eloise joining us, we wouldn’t be known as an employer that lives by its values on a daily basis. So thanks Eloise. We couldn’t be us without you.

Now, if you were to come on board as one of our Assistant Store Managers we’d ask you to do the following:

People Management
Create an environment that fosters open & continuous communication and information sharing among all Associates, Coordinators and Managers.
Praise and recognize efforts and results by providing timely feedback to Coordinators and Associates. Counsel and provide disciplinary actions Associates if required.
Create and maintain a positive environment.
Validate "Great Place to Work" initiatives are in place.
Participate and support the other Assistant Managers in the process of recruiting and hiring Associates.
Facilitate the New Hire onboarding. Reinforce and support the compliance to store structure and compensation guidelines.
Partner with other Management members to ensure that training programs are conducted and Associates development plans are completed.
Continually assesses cross training of Associates and the ability to meet the business needs. Create action plans to resolve any issues.
Prepare and conduct evaluations for all Associates and Coordinators that work primarily in Fitting Rooms, Jewellery, Frontline and Cash Office. Ensure all other reviews are conducted in a timely manner.
Provide coaching, training and development to the Operations Coordinator, Cash Office, Jewellery, Frontline and Fitting Room Associates.
Create and maintain active Development Plans for self and Coordinators.
Maintain and support all company values, leadership competencies and culture factors, code of conduct and maintenance of a risk-free environment.
Operations Management
Communicate sales goals and other financial/business information daily to Coordinators and Associates. Coach and provide direction on how to utilize the information to drive sales for their given areas of responsibility.
Actively Participate in Management Meetings and lead Coordinator Meetings.
Create action plans with Store Manager and other Assistant Managers to maximize and drive sales.
During store visits from Regional Teams, District Managers, Home Office or any other visitor, be prepared with your stores current state and future goals and or challenges for; sales, productivity, event execution and operational issues. Use this time to discuss all of the activities, issues, new programs or plans of action you have implemented in operations.
Periodically complete a comparison analysis of other retailers and provide feedback to store team during Management meetings.
Partner with the Management Team to ensure the right number of Associates have been cross trained to support receiving, processing and merchandising.
Adhere to all TJX Canada policies and procedures and guide execution to drives sales.
Create and validate CRT's
assigned are completed to standard.
Exemplifies 'Total Store Awareness' and full accountability for the business in the absence of the AM or Merchandise, AM of Customer Service and/or Store Manager.
Customer Service
Support and execute the Joy Project
to drive the importance of building strong connections between Managers, Associates, and Customers.
Identify business opportunities through communication with customers and recommend changes that are appropriate to your District Manager.
Participate in the effective execution of the Manager On Duty Program
.
Provide leadership to Associates on delivering excellent customer service.
Address immediate customer service issues and provide appropriate coaching to Associates if required.
Support the processes in the Service Areas (Frontline, Fitting Room, Jewellery) and ensure Associates deliver friendly customer service.
Understand and support the Customer Service Manager in achieving the established customer service metrics.
Sounds rather challenging and exciting, right? Let’s hope so, because if it sounds easy or boring, there’s a good chance this job isn’t for you. But if it does sound right for you, here’s why we know you’ll be able to handle those challenges. You have:

Job Specifications:
College Diploma or University degree preferred; minimum requirement high school education
Related work experience
Demonstrated ability to plan, prioritize, lead large groups, develop people, execute
Ability to problem solve; high degree of decision making, and able to prioritize in a fast paced and changing store environment
Dimensions:
Responsible for sales between $8 to $20 million
Responsible up to eighty (80) Associates per Store

Health and Safety:
Health and Safety in the workplace applies to everyone at WMI.
An Internal Responsibility System makes all parties in the workplace jointly responsible and equally involved to act on all Health and Safety matters.
Success is our favorite outfit! As proud as we are of our past success, it’s our future that excites us most. We strive to provide opportunities for growth, recognition and a competitive salary and benefits package. Share our determination to think bolder and bigger and be part of our future. Apply now.

Here at TJX Canada we are an equal opportunity employer committed to the inclusion and accommodation of all individuals. For additional assistance please email accessiblecareers@tjxcanada.ca.

Job Segment:
Operations Manager, Service Manager, Retail Manager, Retail Operations, Customer Service, Operations, Retail

title: Senior Private Banker
description:
The Senior Private Banker is accountable for providing relationship management, a superior client experience and integrated financial solutions to a portfolio of borrowing and non-borrowing Platinum Banking clients. The role is accountable for contributing to the market business plan and supporting strategies by effectively managing the retention and expansion of existing relationships and attracting new clients with an objective of profitably growing the overall revenue.
The Senior Private Banker provides banking and lending services to support the achievement of market business goals, and makes credit recommendations and decisions in accordance with sound credit-granting principles and in accordance with the Bank’s Policies & Procedures. Through an advisory financial planning based approach, the role works in a deal team environment offering high net worth clients and prospects integrated wealth management solutions through the services of BMO Private Banking and BMO Financial Group, either directly or through referral to business partners.
ACCOUNTABILITIES
Client Relationship Management
Accountable for the quality of opportunity, quality of information obtained to support decisions, and the profitability of each relationship managed.
Provide superior service to an assigned portfolio of high net worth clients with an objective of becoming their trusted advisor.
Apply relationship management principles and techniques to an assigned portfolio of clients and to prospects, providing a unique, value-added client experience in the development of integrated financial solutions to meet client needs.
Provide proactive, integrated and customized advice, and create and implement planning strategies to help clients achieve their financial and personal goals.
Maintain strong knowledge and understanding of financial planning principles, incorporating this approach into each client’s personal financial situation in the development and implementation of planning strategies to help clients achieve their financial and personal goals.
Demonstrate a consultative and collaborative selling approach in customer conversations, acting as a lead or a secondary member of a client deal team in the facilitation of the desired BMO Private Banking client experience and to achieve business goals.
Manage the transition of clients to and from the portfolio using defined processes
Business Delivery
Recommend plans for and work to achieve annual performance objectives and results for business and personal growth.
Provide day-to-day training and support to other banking personnel. Training and support may include providing guidance on credit-related issues, specific client issues and queries, and assistance with operational processes.
Use financial planning skills to effectively apply financial planning concepts against each client’s personal and financial situation.
Maintain up-to-date knowledge and understanding of banking products, processes, and relevant legal, regulatory and technology requirements.
Contribute to the assigned portfolio’s profitability through strict control of non-interest expense items and profitable pricing practices for credit and non-credit products and services.
Provide timely and effective problem resolution, escalating customer issues as necessary.
Maintain effective relationships with Private Banking Officers, Professional Services Managers and other deal team partners to build a collaborative working environment that focuses on client needs and the delivery of the desired client experience.
Risk Management and Control
Protect the Bank’s assets by adhering to all policies and procedures, lending processes, legal and ethical requirements and regulations, audit requirements, and established risk guidelines. Ensure all business is in conformity with Bank Policies and other guidelines.
Respond to questions and resolve issues raised on assigned portfolio, through audits and quality checks to ensure lending decisions are adequately documented, clearly communicated and followed.
Manage risk and minimize losses through monitoring and control reports, ensuring compliance requirements audits and verifications are completed in accordance with Bank Policies & Procedures and all legal, regulatory and ethical requirements.
Document and follow-up on any discrepancies to procedures, with significant operational risk and escalate.
Adhere to Know Your Customer standards, policies and procedures for the prevention of loss due to fraud, counterfeiting, money laundering, or defalcation; identify and report suspicious and other reportable transactions or patterns of activity that are suspected to be related to money laundering.
Maintain up-to-date knowledge and understanding of all banking products, processes, and relevant legal, regulatory and technology requirements.
Adhere to all aspects of First Principles our code of business conduct and ethics, including individual accountability as it relates to potential conflicts of interest, safeguarding of customer information, trading in securities, anti-money laundering, privacy and disclosure of outside business activities.
Mitigate risks identified and make credit recommendations and decisions that are in accordance with sound credit-granting principles and in compliance with the Bank’s philosophy and principles as outlined in Corporate Risk Policy as well as appropriate supporting policies and procedures.
Exercise individually held unilateral discretionary limits, as well as any held prescribed approval discretionary limits, ensuring credit decisions and recommendations are in accordance with sound credit-granting principles and in compliance with the Bank’s policies and related procedures; completing analysis; confirming security valuations; completing and approving credit applications for authorizations under Consumer or Commercial lending policies.
Liaise with or escalate to appropriate BMO Private Banking partners and leadership and Credit early in the process when significant deteriorating trends are evident, working with them to engage other BMO specialty roles or Collections/SAMU as appropriate to ensure Bank assets are adequately protected.
Respect the Bank’s credit process and is accountable for proper structuring of credit transactions, for provision of accurate and complete data to the credit system, for ensuring appropriate investigation to minimize risk to the Bank, and for the quality of credit granting and loan documentation.
Business Development
Develop a 12 to 18 month rolling plan to achieve targets.
Work in a deal team environment with other professionals using planning based approach to develop, maintain and execute an ongoing growth and retention strategy for clients within the portfolio. When acting a lead relationship manager, assemble and lead deal team participation of professionals appropriate to client needs.
Continuously look for ways to enhance the BMO Private Banking and BMO Financial Group presence in the marketplace by crafting innovative business development strategies and work closely with other BMO Private Banking and BMO Financial Group professionals in support of their business development activities.
Develop profitable new business leads through extensive external networks. Act as an ambassador to assist BMO Financial Group in enhancing its marketplace presence and growing its services in the community.
Provide a strong level of understanding of the financial services, financial planning and investment management industries to effectively implement appropriate business development strategies.
Partner with the leadership team on strategic direction and complex line-of-business projects.
Negotiate appropriate pricing using discretion where required to build a profitable portfolio
Proactively develop internal and external networks for referral sources that effectively generate prospects for new business by being highly visible in the marketplace.
Enhance Private Bank’s profile by participating in meaningful and focused business and community activities, seeking out and creating opportunities to generate new Private Banking business.
This role requires the incumbent to interact with the following groups:

Professional Services:

Proactively share customer information.
Work collaboratively to develop new business opportunities and proactively share insights and ideas to all deal team members.
Take ownership of client issues and loan approval process and escalate as required in accordance with established credit guidelines.
Promptly action requests for additional information, deteriorating risk or early warning signs.
Provide information required for credit preparation for new and existing credits and annual reviews.
Private Banking Officers:
Proactively share customer information to enable PBO to provide superior level of customer service to clients.
Provide requests for security preparation, security verification and loan drawdown requests.
Provide requests for banking services set-up and servicing.
Identify sales and referral opportunities within existing client base.
Credit Department:
Provide timely advice of deficiencies, material exceptions, deteriorating risk and early warning signals.
Approval of credit transactions.
Receive advice relative to application of credit skills
Investment Counsellors and Wealth Services Professionals:
Work in a deal team environment to develop new opportunities and provide creative solutions.
Work collaboratively to develop new business opportunities and proactively share insights and ideas to all deal team members.
Identify referral opportunities.
Knowledge:
University degree/MBA/CA/CMA/CGA or equivalent job-related experience
5 to 7 years banking experience
Working knowledge of Personal and Commercial credit and non-credit products.
Discretionary Personal and Commercial credit limits for Private Banking transactions (refer to Appendix A).
Financial Planning designation.
RISR qualified
Skills:
3 to 5 years of experience in high net worth client business development.
3 to 5 years of presenting planning strategies, including 1 to 3 years experience using financial planning software.
In-depth sales and client service skills
In-depth business development skills with successful track record
In-depth interpersonal and communication skills
Analytical thinking in a systematic way and developing solutions
Expert relationship management skills to effectively manage relationships across multiple levels of the organization, across lines of business, across various BMO Financial Group partners, and with non-BMO contacts and sources.
Able to work independently, resolving complex or ambiguous issues or situations.
We’re here to help
At BMO we have a shared purpose; we put the customer at the centre of everything we do – helping people is in our DNA. For 200 years we have thought about the future—the future of our customers, our communities and our people. We help our customers and our communities by working together, innovating and pushing boundaries to bring them our very best every day. Together we’re changing the way people think about a bank.
As a member of the BMO team you are valued, respected and heard, and you have more ways to grow and make an impact. We strive to help you make an impact from day one – for yourself and our customers. We’ll support you with the tools and resources you need to reach new milestones, as you help our customers reach theirs. From in-depth training and coaching, to manager support and network-building opportunities, we’ll help you gain valuable experience, and broaden your skillset.
To find out more visit us at https://bmocareers.com.
BMO is committed to an inclusive, equitable and accessible workplace. By learning from each other’s differences, we gain strength through our people and our perspectives. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

title: Manufacturing Automation and Controls Engineer
description:
INVISTA has invested greatly in the Kingston Manufacturing Site recently completing projects in power cogeneration, energy efficiency, and automation. Come join the innovative team as we continue to accept challenges and shape our future.
The Manufacturing Automation and Controls Engineer is an integral part of the Process Control Team for the Kingston Technology Group at Kingston Site. This role’s primary focus is to bring expert knowledge to Kingston site with respect to PLC and control systems, wireless infrastructure/controls, robotics, machine vision and camera/vision systems, positioning systems, and related infrastructure and applications. This position provides expertise and support in all areas of machine controls related to the manufacturing environment at INVISTA Kingston site. The position requires strong ownership, critical thinking, and troubleshooting skills.

Expectations and Challenges of the Role:
PLC and DCS Implementation, programming, and troubleshooting
Collaborate with Operations, PCN/IT, and maintenance/reliability teams to design/support and implement highly efficient manufacturing solutions related to industrial controls, robotics, and vision systems
Brings best practice knowledge on the implementation of automated manufacturing solutions, plant of the future, industrial wireless communications, and internet of things (IoT)
Create and maintain and provide input for documentation related to controls infrastructure and applications
Provide support to Research & Development group for “factory of the future” pilot testing and implementation
Training of additional personnel on PLC’s, robotics, vision systems, and related infrastructure
Support and troubleshoot existing automated manufacturing processes
Reverse-engineer application software related to manufacturing control systems to relieve dependency on external vendors
Design input and cost estimation for capital equipment and automation projects related to the advancement of automation in the manufacturing space
Provide oversight and direction to vendors and third-party integrators/providers for all implementations and upgrades within the automation space related to manufacturing
Required Education, Skills, and Experience:
Associate's or Bachelor's degree in Electrical, Automation, Computer Engineering, with a minimum of four years of industry experience working within a fast-paced manufacturing/process environment, preferably those involving industrial control environments.
Expertise / experience with Microsoft server and workstation operating systems
Expertise / experience with various vendor PLC and HMI systems (Rockwell, Schneider, etc.)
Ability to work occasional overtime and weekend "on-call" shifts as required to support business requirements
What Will Put You Ahead?
Hands-on expertise with many PLC/HMI systems, and other modern DCS/PLC control system platforms
Hands-on expertise with control systems, automated manufacturing systems (conveyors, tables, AGV’s, etc.), and robotics (Fanuc)
Experience with industrial wireless technologies and implementation best practices
Knowledge of industrial protocols related to control systems such as Modbus RTU/TCP, OPC, etc.
Knowledge and experience interfacing with production data historian systems such as AspenTech IP21
Excellent time management skills and a team player, with experience collaborating with multi-disciplinary teams across a large production facility

Why Work for INVISTA?
A culture that places top priority on integrity and compliance
Opportunity for career growth at one of the largest, financially stable companies in the world
Encouragement to challenge the status quo and share knowledge
Ability to contribute to a shared vision of innovation while conserving resources
Personal Protective Equipment

The ability to wear personal protective equipment, with or without accommodation, such as: Steel-toed shoes, ear plugs, safety glasses, face shields, gloves, hard hats, and other protective equipment as may be required in the operating areas
We Provide:
Competitive salary
Flexible benefits package
Defined benefit pension plan
Optional pension enhancements
Performance bonus program
Additional vacation purchase program
Additional floating holidays
Education Assistance Program for job related training
Advancement opportunities
How to apply:
Picture yourself at INVISTA and submit a detailed resume in English along with a covering letter to www.invistacareers.com
Successful candidates will be required to complete a criminal background check.
If you have the above qualifications, we would like to hear from you. We thank all applicants in advance, but please be advised that only those selected for an interview will be contacted.
We are an equal opportunity employer. If you require accommodation or assistance at any time during the application or selection processes, please submit a request by following the directions located at the bottom of the kochcareers.com webpage
Want to learn more about INVISTA?
Headquartered in the U.S., INVISTA is one of the world's largest integrated producers of polymers and fibers, primarily for nylon, spandex, and polyester applications. With a business presence in more than 20 countries, INVISTA delivers exceptional value for its customers through market insights, technology innovations, and a powerful portfolio of global trademarks including Lycra® fiber, Coolmax® fabric, Cordura® fabric, Antron® carpet fiber and Stainmaster® carpet. We transform daily through innovations. Clothing, carpets, luggage, plastic bottles, automobile interiors and airbags- these and many other products originate in one of INVISTA's global manufacturing facilities. You can be a part of the difference we make by joining the INVISTA team.

As a member of the INVISTA team, you will also be part of Koch Industries, Inc.'s affiliates, one of the largest privately-held companies in the world. Koch companies have a presence in nearly 60 countries and employ over 120,000 people worldwide. For more information on INVISTA, please visit www.INVISTA.com.

title: Now Hiring - Event Sales Representative
description:
Job Description
About Us:

We are in search of the most ambitious and confident individuals to start their career in Promotional Sales and Event Marketing immediately!

Due to our recent expansion, we need to staff events with 10 employees immediately. No experience is necessary, we provide a guaranteed weekly paycheque, with complete paid training and bonuses!

Our events run are local to Kingston and the surrounding cities. Must be able to commute daily to our Kingston office for meetings.

This Position Offers:
Opportunities for promotions (we only promote within)
International and domestic travel opportunities
Complete paid training with a base salary
Young, fun, diverse team atmosphere
What We Need You To Offer:
Outgoing, positive and confident personality
Strong work ethic
Flair for dealing with customers
Solid communication skills
Willingness to learn
Reliable transportation to and from work
We look for individuals with previous experience in:
Retail
Hospitality/Restaurant Industry
Customer Service
Sales-Management
If you are hard working and driven to succeed, then you will have the FULL SUPPORT of our entire team, along with COMPLETE TRAINING.

NOT A 100% COMMISSION POSITION! GUARANTEED BASE PAY!

You don't need to be a sales "guru" (we will train you to become one!), you only need to possess a positive, go-getter attitude in order to succeed and be part of our close-knit team.

We are setting up interviews this coming week, so apply now for early consideration!
Company Description
We specialize in creating tailored marketing and consulting services for our Fortune 500 clients.
Our daily work environment is fun, fast paced and energetic.

Our goal is simple: we want to help our clients exceed their goals by providing world class service, quality, and value. Simultaneous to this goal, we also look to provide an avenue to develop vibrant, enthusiastic individuals who are eager to learn and grow within our company.

title: Systems Engineers-Rail & Transit
description:
Job Description

SNC-Lavalin provides cutting-edge engineering, procurement, construction and financing solutions to projects in more than 100 countries around the world. From the Canadian Arctic to the Southern African region and Australasia, our multicultural workforce is driven by a fierce pride in their work and a pioneering vision.

SNC-Lavalin is truly a global leader in its field, and has been chosen to design and build some of the most prestigious prizes in the world. Within Canada, our Rail & Transit team has been selected to design and deliver most of the recent Greenfield and Brownfield LRT, ALRT and Light Metro jobs awarded in the last 10 years including the Canada Line, Calgary West LRT, Edmonton North LRT, the Evergreen Line, the Confederation Line and Eglinton-Crosstown. We are actively working on delivering the Confederation Line (Ottawa) and Eglinton-Crosstown (Toronto) and have a number of other projects at the proposal stage or awaiting award.

Our Rail & Transit Engineering team deliver systems solutions that include alignment and track, traction power and distribution, signalling and train control, and communications. One of the key components of our systems delivery is Systems Integration encompassing the engineering work required to manage and deliver the integration of systems, sub-systems and components of a rail transit project; in light of our current and future workloads, we are also open to looking at candidates that come from systems backgrounds in:

Traction Power and distribution

Signalling, Communications and Train Control

Alignment and Track design

Rolling Stock

Responsibilities:
Development of Systems Engineering processes and documentation
Support of Systems Integration processes and documentation
Support of Systems Delivery processes and documentation
Interaction with Design Management and Technical Leads
Interaction with Construction Management and Delivery Leads
Interaction with O&M/M&R Management and Support Leads
Support of construction and installation activities in the field
Support for Test & Commissioning and setting to work of mass transit, urban rail and heavy freight signalling and control systems
Support for System Assurance/V&V teams in the delivery of mass transit, urban rail and heavy freight signalling and control systems.
Skills and Experiences
Essential – Experience across a variety of light rail, metro and commuter railway systems, with specific project and system engineering knowledge and expertise in this domain
Essential – Knowledge of system engineering practices and processes, and experience of putting them into action
Essential – Able to lead a team of systems integration and system engineering professionals
Essential – Able to lead discussions with the partners, clients and suppliers and to interact with senior discipline staff as overall delivery lead
Essential – Excellent MS Office skills, especially Excel and Word
Experience of multi-disciplinary technical environments, people management and financial management.
Excellent written, presentation and communication/briefing skills; able to present to large audiences of industry experts.
Excellent networking and client relationship management skills; able to influence and manage key stakeholders and build trust and advocacy with clients.
Excellent people management and interpersonal skills; able to engage staff and address difficult issue effectively and fairly.
Highly desirable – Knowledge of system integration practices, processes and principles, and experience of putting them into action.
Highly desirable – Degree qualified with a minimum 10 years relevant experience.

Travel:
Must be willing to travel to project sites
Must be willing to travel to vendor locations
Must be able to work away from home for periods of time

Qualifications:
P.Eng designation with PEO is required
Must have at least 6-12 years of relevant experience
Rail experience is required
Worker TypeEmployeeJob TypeRegular

At SNC-Lavalin, we seek to hire individuals with diverse characteristics, backgrounds and perspectives. We strongly believe that world-class talent makes no distinctions based on gender, ethnic or national origin, sexual identity and orientation, age, religion or disability, but enriches itself through these differences.

title: Sales Consultant - Product Specialist
description:
MotoSport Plus is expanding the sales team and we want YOU to join us! With continued increases in sales on new and used motorcycles we currently have immediate openings for Sales Consultants / Product Specialists.

Job Type: Permanent Full-Time (with benefits after 90 days)

Salary: Base Wage Plus Commission

Required education: High School or Equivalent OMVIC Certification

WHAT WE OFFER!!!

A competitive compensation package, with the opportunity to earn above average income. Additionally, we provide a comprehensive medical and dental benefit package. We also provide extensive training on Harley-Davidson and Honda Motorcycles both on-the-job as well as training seminars / courses offered outside of the dealership. Our mentoring program is second to none and is on-going to ensure you will exceed your goals.

Responsibilities:

Providing our customers with the best experience in the industry**
Thoroughly knowing the Harley-Davidson and Honda Motorcycle brands
Following our sales process, including prospecting, greeting, qualifying, presentation, demonstration, closing, delivery and follow-up
Meeting and exceeding monthly targets

Qualifications:

Highly motivated and goal orientated**
Experience in a customer service based role
Experience in a sales type role an asset
Motorcycle sales experience an asset but not mandatory WE WILL TRAIN!
OMVIC certified and must be able to provide Canadian Background Check.
Strong team player

If interested in a challenging, exciting and fun career opportunity, then please forward your resume to this job ad.

title: Floor Stock Handler - Hudson's Bay
description:
Job Description
Role Mandate:
You are a friendly, customer-focused individual who understands the importance and intricacies of being ready to serve the customer. In a performance driven culture, you excel at executing the Customer Service Strategy and delivering results.

Responsibilities:
• Understand the competitive market and promote the advantages of HBC brands
Assisting with the organization of the stock room

Demonstrated customer focus
Demonstrated strong communication and motivation skills
Ability to translate behaviours into optimal selling experience and achievement of results
Detail oriented; results-oriented

title: Assistant Sales Manager- Naturalizer
description:
Since 1927, we have been dedicated to giving women beautiful, versatile shoes that feel exceptional. We create a rewarding experience for each and every customer.

Were looking for shoe enthusiasts who love hands-on selling and have a desire to work in a specialty retail, sales-driven environment. If youre passionate about current fashion and enduring style, you belong on our team!

We seek an Assistant Sales Manager who:
Coaches and demonstrates the Naturalizer selling model to achieve sales goals
Supports the implementation of company plans and strategies
Demonstrates a passion for exceeding customer expectations
Assures compliance, education and support of federal, state/provincial and local laws
Naturalizer is a retail division of Caleres, a $2.6 billion footwear company with a diverse portfolio of global footwear brands, which fit peoples lives. We offer competitive pay, career advancement opportunities and a 30% shoe discount. Apply today!

title: Retail Representative-Eastern Ontario
description:
A mutually rewarding experience.

Work. Realize your ambitions. And realize there’s more to being in business than just making a profit. That’s the Mars philosophy. And the opportunity we offer every one of our Associates. An opportunity to take what you do and make it mean more for you, for those around you and for the planet. What you get here is challenging, interesting work. You get the tools you need to do a great job and you get to have the best possible people on your side to help you do it. And at the same time as getting to find ways to do business better today than we did it yesterday and driving a great career, you also get to build a more enlightened business and drive sustainability.

Because it’s never just about a single person, a single project or a single brand. It’s about how you can grab everything that’s within your reach here and use it to pursue mutual, long-term gain. It’s about having ideas. And ideals. Being prepared to risk failure because the promise of success means we’ll all be a little better off. It’s that mix of integrity and ambition that makes Mars such a special place to work. And why working here is always about more than just a job.

Mars has net sales of more than $33 billion, operates six business segments including Petcare, Chocolate, Wrigley, Food, Drinks, Symbioscience, and more than 75,000 Associates worldwide that are putting its Principles into action to make a difference for people and the planet through its performance.

Mars brands include: Petcare – PEDIGREE®, ROYAL CANIN®, WHISKAS®, BANFIELD® Pet Hospital, CESAR®, SHEBA®, DREAMIES® and NUTRO®; Chocolate – M&M’S®, SNICKERS®, DOVE®, GALAXY®, MARS®, MILKY WAY® and TWIX®; Wrigley – DOUBLEMINT®, EXTRA®, ORBIT® and 5™ chewing gums, SKITTLES® and STARBURST® candies, and ALTOIDS® AND LIFESAVERS® mints. Food – UNCLE BEN’S®, DOLMIO®, EBLY®, MASTERFOODS®, SEEDS OF CHANGE® and ROYCO®; Drinks – ALTERRA COFFEE ROASTERS™, THE BRIGHT TEA COMPANY™, KLIX® and FLAVIA®; Symbioscience – COCOAVIA® and WISDOM PANEL®.

Mars Canada is a subsidiary of the US family-owned business known as Mars, Incorporated, one of the leading global manufacturers of branded products. Established in the late 1940's, our three segments – Petcare, Chocolate and Food help Canadians celebrate life everyday through food experiences. We are an organization that is guided by our Five Principles: Quality, Responsibility, Mutuality, Efficiency and Freedom. It is putting these principles into action that allows us to make a difference to people and the planet, through our performance.

Part-Time Retail Representative- Foods

(3 days/week)

Key Accountabilities

Scope:

The Retail Representative is responsible for selling, distribution and merchandising Mars Canada Food products within an assigned territory for assigned retail customers.

Selling and Distribution:

•Responsible for suggesting order and selling presentation programs to customers

•Presenting and selling booking sheets to stores

•Maintaining distribution of assigned products

Merchandising excellence:

•Ensuring shelves are stocked with all listed product

•Refilling of merchandiser fixtures, including Mars Canada racks as well as working with the customer to secure secondary space for building of display

•POS where applicable

•Rotation of products both on-shelf and in backroom to ensure optimal product quality and freshness

Data Collection/Integrity:

•Maintain appropriate data either through hand-held technology or in paper form as determined by the business

Ensuring Call-coverage:

•Proper territory management through customer coverage that involves efficient and effective use of time and resources

•Must plan and organize route schedule according to company call coverage model, complying with the frequency and time-in call for each banner

Communication and Administration:

•Keep District Sales Manager up-to-date regarding territory activities

•Maintain an adequate stock of relevant merchandising supplies and POS materials.

•Ensure Retail Representative Sales Manual is maintained and kept up to date with relevant information

•Follow company procedures for processing credits/rapid rafts

•Read through and understand content of weekly mail packages

•Special Projects:

•May be responsible for supporting special projects for Sales team as assigned

Key Lateral Responsibilities

•Marketing Teams

•Other responsibilities

Key Technical Knowledge and Skills

•Good communication and presentation skills

•Demonstrated ability to merchandise products in a variety of outlets

•Good written and verbal communication and one-on-one presentation skills

•Ability to store display materials/POS at at a secure/personal location at no cost to the business

•Demonstrated self-motivation with the ability to execute a distribution/display plan with limited supervision

•Ability to lift product (maximum lifting requirement 50 pounds)

•Ability to drive approximately 100 km daily while making sales calls

•Ability to sustain repeated movement which includes but is not limited to in and out of car movement, bending, leaning, reaching, pushing, pulling and grasping motions

•Ability to use hand tools like Scotty peelers, pliers, wrenches and screw drivers to assemble displays

Other:

•Ability to secure level of vehicle insurance coverage as determined by Company

•All other duties and responsibilities as assigned

•Responsible for following all Quality and Food Safety Policies and applicable procedures.

A criminal records check will be required for this position.

title: Retail Associate FT WOW! mobile boutique
description:
WOW! mobile boutique - Wireless Sales Associate

Match Transact; a division of Match Marketing Group, will launch and operate a new wireless retail experience to serve Canadian consumers. WOW! mobile boutique™ will offer brands and the latest wireless plans and hardware from leading Canadian carriers in mall-based kiosks.

Match Transact will present a unique shopping experience at WOW! mobile boutique kiosks not available with other mall-based wireless retailers. Our highly trained frontline associates will bring an enhanced customer-focused approach, with unbiased advice and assistance.

The world of wireless telecom is ever evolving and this is your opportunity to be a pioneer in changing the way people think about and shop for mobile services.

Our mission is to provide the most helpful, friendly, unbiased wireless solutions to every visitor, at every touch point along their path to confidence, purchase and advocacy.

WOW! mobile boutique is immediately recruiting for full time and part time Sales Associates to spearhead this paradigm shift. We will be introducing a new way to shop for mobile service by offering a warm and friendly wireless journey focused on providing customer-centric solutions.

This isn’t your typical mobile job; you will drive sales and hit key performance metrics all while working in an exciting, friendly and unbiased environment gaining experience with the latest technology across multiple carriers. There is potential for growth and career development.

A competitive hourly wage with commission structure will allow you to translate your passion for mobile technology, and customer service into creating an outstanding, pleasant and satisfying experience for your customers at all times.

Duties and Responsibilities:
Responsible for achieving all key business objectives including sales, revenue and customer experience.
Follow operational guidelines to ensure all compliance standards are being met.
Complete all required training within specified timelines.
Complete weekly coaching sheets for review with Management and follow recommended course of action to further develop sales skills.
Ensure all scheduled shifts are completed, including clocking in/out as per guidelines.
Follow dress guidelines for every shift and ensure the brand is appropriately represented at all times.
Complete all assigned tasked delegated by Management.
Required Skills
Minimum of 2 years progressive retail sales or customer service experience (preferably in wireless)
Experience in the wireless space considered an asset
Proven track record of sales
Superb communication and customer service skills
Friendly and professional attitude
Pay Rate
Hourly Wage + commission
Required Experience

title: Seasonal AZ Driver
description:

PepsiCo Canada employs nearly 10,000 Canadians and is organized into two business units - PepsiCo Beverages Canada, which includes brands such as Pepsi, Gatorade and Tropicana; and PepsiCo Foods Canada, which includes Frito Lay Canada and Quaker foods & snacks. title: Campus Representative
description:
The Princeton Review is THE destination for college and grad bound students to make their dreams a reality. Last year alone, we helped more than 3.5 million students get into their dream college or grad school. How do we do it? Online and in-person tutoring and test prep from top-notch educators as well as more than 150 books and personalized college counseling. We need ambitious, innovative people to join our team to continue our success as an education leader. If you are passionate about education, want to give millions of students the edge they need to succeed and be part of a fast growing internet business then you're in the right place. For more info, visit www.princetonreview.com and www.facebook.com/ThePrincetonReview, Follow us on Twitter @ThePrincetonRev

As The Princeton Review's Campus Representative, you will be the vital link between your school campus and our local office. Campus Representatives are essential to our ability to forge new relationships and nurture existing ones. They serve as our primary points of contact with student groups and execute various on-campus marketing activities. As an advocate for The Princeton Review, you will help students figure out how we will best prep them to ace their tests. In fact, our Campus Representatives are the primary reason many students enroll in our test prep programs!

Commitment:
Although the responsibilities of the position vary week-to-week, the time commitment is typically in the range of 5 to 7 hours per week.

Typical Duties:
Coordinating with student group leaders on campus helping plan and organize on-campus events manning a TPR table of events posting flyers on campus additional duties assigned as necessary.

Desired Skills & Experience:

at least an undergraduate sophomore familiar with student groups on your campus self-motivated, flexible, go-getter, and proactive personality Pre-Law, Pre-Health, Pre-Business majors strongly encouraged to apply Familiarity with standardized tests (like the SAT, ACT, MCAT, LSAT, GRE), College Admissions, Medical Admissions, or Graduate Admissions is a plus!

Required Experience:strong organization and time-management skills strong communication skills and experience either in marketing or providing presentations. able to work independently basic computer skills (E-mail, Excel, and Word)

Perks:

course discount bonus plan flexible schedule

Equal Opportunity Employer

For more information, visit www.princetonreview.com and www.facebook.com/ThePrincetonReview. Follow us on Twitter @ThePrincetonRev

Equal Opportunity Employer Minorities/Women/Protected Veterans/Disabled

title: MCAT Prep Instructor
description:
In 2015, Kaplan was voted one of the Top 100 Best Places to work by Fortune magazine. One of the many reasons people love to work at Kaplan is our people, and our unyielding determination to make a difference in people's lives. We're passionate about what we do and the students we do it for. Kaplan educates more than one million students worldwide each year and is recognized as a global leader in education. But it’s our culture of collaboration, innovation, and creativity that truly makes Kaplan a great place to work – and positions us to continue to deliver a best-in-class educational experience. If you’re looking to join the team of an industry leader, in a fast-paced, innovative environment, learn more about the exciting career opportunities available at Kaplan today.

Job Title

MCAT Prep Instructor - Kingston, ON

Job Description

Kaplan is seeking dynamic and engaging presenters, with a proven ability to motivate others, as part-time MCAT Instructors. In this leadership role, you will provide exceptional instruction and demonstrate subject matter expertise on all sections of the exam. To qualify, you must have a MCAT score (either on the official test or a Kaplan practice test) at or above 33 on the old MCAT or 513 on the 2015 MCAT. While training, prep time, and other administrative duties may be completed at home or remotely, teaching and tutoring hours are conducted on-site in specific locations. Our self-driven, online training program addresses changes to the 2015 MCAT: new sections and content, the impact on pre-med career trajectory, the role of new MCAT in admissions, etc. Kaplan’s comprehensive training suite (20-25 hours of asynchronous, self-paced modules and exercises) will also help you develop your presentation, mentoring, and classroom management skills. All training and training-related activities are paid. With Kaplan you will build your resume and expand your professional network at an industry-leading company, all while positively impacting the lives of local pre-med students. Why Kaplan? Flexible Scheduling: While training, prep time, and other administrative duties may be completed at home or remotely, teaching and tutoring hours are conducted on-site in specific locations Evening/weekend classes make this a great option for supplemental income Classes meet 1 to 3 sessions per week (equivalent of 10-20 hours of work per week) Up to 50% of your time is flextime, allowing you to work from home on your own schedule Opportunities to teach multiple classes and for one-on-one tutoring Unique Benefits: Receive a 15%-20% discount each month on your existing cell phone service plan (US-based employees only, carriers include AT&T, Sprint, T-Mobile, Verizon) Free or discounted USMLE prep and other test prep services through Kaplan

Location

Kingston, ON, CAN

Additional Locations

Employee Type

Employee

Job Functional Area

Instructors

Kaplan is an Equal Opportunity Employer

title: Registered Nurse PT - REPO Peri/Surg
description:
Registered Nurse, Resource Pool – Perinatal/Surgical

Part-Time Position; Rotating shifts

ONA (KGH)

Kingston General Hospital Site

DESCRIPTION:

The RN is responsible for ensuring that practice and conduct meets legislative requirements and the standards of the profession as designed by the College of Nurses of Ontario. Nurses in the Perinatal/Surgical Pool will be assigned to nursing units within the Perinatal Parameter Group (C5, K5, NICU and Pediatrics) and the Surgical Parameter Group (K6, K3, K4, D5). RNs’ practice will also comply with Kingston General Hospital’s policies and procedures.

Within this role the Registered Nurse is accountable for contributing to the delivery of the Kingston General Hospital strategy. As an employee, one must demonstrate an awareness of and be responsible for actively promoting and supporting patient and family centered engagement and care in all we do.

PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES & DUTIES:

The RN initiates and coordinates interprofessional team assessments and plans of care including physical, spiritual and psychosocial needs of patients across the continuum of care. Delivers care and provides care coordination for an assigned group of patients in an ambulatory and/or inpatient setting. Plans, organizes and establishes priorities based on individual patient’s needs and scheduled activities and adjusts priorities and activities in response to unanticipated events. Develops plans of care to achieve identified patient goals within the ambulatory and/or inpatient setting and including planning for transitions within and from the hospital setting. Provides teaching and learning experiences for both patient and family. Coordinates family communication, family meetings and conferences. Performs therapeutic measures as prescribed by members of the professional care team and as indicated by the nursing diagnosis. Maintains appropriate records of observation, nursing care administered and patient’s response. Communicates regularly with the interprofessional team members throughout the patient care experience. Assigns, teaches and supervises Patient Care Assistants/Volunteers. Acts as the key contact person for new interprofessional team members and assigned group of patients. Performs Charge Nurse responsibilities for a tour of duty as assigned. Provides for an environment which is conducive to the safety and well-being of patients, visitors and staff by practicing and promoting accident prevention; by being familiar with emergency procedures and regulations, by using skills, physical facilities, supplies and equipment safely and appropriately; and by being alert to infection hazards and infection control procedures. Maintains competence in nursing practice through in-service and continuing education. Participates in nursing research. Serves on departmental and related committees when and as requested. Interprets nursing department and hospital policies to patients, families and visitors. Performs related work as requested. Adheres to the worker responsibilities as set out in the Occupational Health & Safety Act, hospital safety policies and dept./unit established procedures at all times.

NOTE: The above duties are representative but are not to be construed as all inclusive. Please see People Services on Watkins 4 for the full Job Description.

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS:
Eligible for registration with the College of Nurses of Ontario.
Knowledge and competence in CPR.
One year surgical nursing experience within the last three years preferred.
One year perinatal nursing experience within the last three years preferred.
Demonstrated interpersonal and communication skills coupled with the ability to work on a multidisciplinary team an asset.
Proven ability to attend work regularly.
Satisfactory criminal reference check required.
PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS:

The physical demand will vary dependent on the specific unit or service. The incumbent will be required to meet the physical demands described for that unit of services.

title: Operations Lead
description:
INVISTA has invested greatly in the Kingston Manufacturing Site recently completing projects in power cogeneration, energy efficiency, and automation. Come join the innovative team as we continue to accept challenges and shape our future.
The Operations Lead is the key operations project person accountable for development, funding arrangement, final implementation and financial benefit of capital and expense projects at Kingston Site. 5 plus years of operating experience in manufacturing

Construction coordination

Formal Project Management training

We Provide:

Optional pension enhancements

How to apply:
Picture yourself at INVISTA and submit a detailed resume in English along with a covering letter to www.invistacareers.com
Successful candidates will be required to complete a criminal background check.
If you have the above qualifications, we would like to hear from you. We thank all applicants in advance, but please be advised that only those selected for an interview will be contacted.
We are an equal opportunity employer. If you require accommodation or assistance at any time during the application or selection processes, please submit a request by following the directions located at the bottom of the kochcareers.com webpage
Want to learn more about INVISTA?
Headquartered in the U.S., INVISTA is one of the world's largest integrated producers of polymers and fibers, primarily for nylon, spandex, and polyester applications. With a business presence in more than 20 countries, INVISTA delivers exceptional value for its customers through market insights, technology innovations, and a powerful portfolio of global trademarks including Lycra® fiber, Coolmax® fabric, Cordura® fabric, Antron® carpet fiber and Stainmaster® carpet. We transform daily through innovations. Clothing, carpets, luggage, plastic bottles, automobile interiors and airbags- these and many other products originate in one of INVISTA's global manufacturing facilities. You can be a part of the difference we make by joining the INVISTA team.

As a member of the INVISTA team, you will also be part of Koch Industries, Inc.'s affiliates, one of the largest privately-held companies in the world. Koch companies have a presence in nearly 60 countries and employ over 120,000 people worldwide. For more information on INVISTA, please visit www.INVISTA.com.

company: Trillium Gift of Life Network – Kingston
description:
Tissue Recovery Coordinator - Kingston

Casual Contract Position

Are you looking to make a difference in peoples lives? Are you looking for flexible hours? Do you have a valid G class drivers license with immediate access to a vehicle?

If you value an organization that provides the opportunity for and encourages individual growth, and you have experience working in a clinical lab, a healthcare environment, or tissue recovery and processing, this role is for you!

Trillium Gift of Life Network (TGLN) is an agency of the Ministry of Health and Long Term Care responsible for the coordination of organ and tissue donation and transplantation in Ontario. Our mandate includes increasing public awareness of the importance of organ and tissue donation, education of health care professionals, and ensuring a safe and effective donation and transplant system in Ontario. Working collaboratively with our stakeholders and fostering organizational and individual growth, we value honesty, trust, respect and compassion.

For a closer look at our tissue program and to experience what it would be like to work with us, please click on the link below:

Tissue Program

TGLN is currently seeking a Tissue Recovery Coordinator (TRC) to be based out of the Kingston Area. Reporting directly to the Manager, Tissue Recovery, this position shall be responsible for providing professional services in a manner that is consistent with the mission and values of TGLN. The Tissue Recovery Coordinator is passionate about tissue and organ donation and is dedicated to achieving optimal outcomes in the donation process through effective collaboration with the health care team.

The Tissue Recovery Coordinator role offers the opportunity to develop expertise in the surgical recovery phase of the tissue donation process.

This position is based out of Kingston and involves travel primarily throughout the Kingston area and as required anywhere in the province for the surgical recovery of human eyes.

The Tissue Recovery Coordinator will typically be scheduled for 12 hours on-call and the shifts are days and nights. You will be given additional compensation when you are dispatched to a case. Specifically, the incumbent will be responsible for:

Duties & Responsibilities:
Performs the surgical recovery of eye tissue (in-situ/corneal excision and whole globe) from deceased individuals, packages and transports tissues in accordance with TGLN and Health Canada standards using aseptic technique.
As required will assist with the recovery of human heart valves, skin and muscle-skeletal tissues
Coordinates the tissue recovery process, which includes assessing the medical suitability of potential tissue donors in collaboration with members of the TGLN team.
Performs the screening, evaluation, packaging and transportation of human tissue, and collection of blood and other test samples in accordance with TGLN standards.
Performs technical duties in support of the recovery such as medical chart review, blood draw and physical examination of the deceased as well as other technical responsibilities.
Works closely with TGLNs Provincial Resource Centre and local healthcare professionals throughout the process to obtain required information and support.
Ensures that all documentation is recorded accurately and completely. Reviews documentation to ensure accuracy, completeness and compliance with established processes.
Maintains and prepares equipment and supplies.
Assists with projects, and the development of processes and documentation.
Performs quality control functions related to the role.
Performs other duties consistent with the role, as required.
Qualifications & Experience:
University degree or college diploma in health sciences, nursing (RPN), biological sciences or a recognized equivalent is required.
Four (4) years work experience in a health sciences environment specifically in organ and tissue donation, tissue recovery and processing, or clinical laboratory medical setting is preferred or a combination of equivalent experience and education.
Demonstrated in depth knowledge of biological and health sciences as well as quality assurance and aseptic technique is preferred.
Certification in eye or tissue banking, blood banking or laboratory technology is an asset.
Proven ability to maintain and protect patient confidentiality at all times, demonstrating use of discretion and sound judgment.
Proven ability to work independently and collaboratively as part of a team.
Demonstration of good hand-eye coordination, fine motor skills and surgical conscience are required.
Demonstrated superior written and oral communication skills.
A valid class G driver's license without restrictions and access to a reliable vehicle is required
Ability to work a variety of 12 hour shifts including days, nights and weekends is required.
Ability to travel throughout the assigned area and on occasion as required across the province, on each shift as needed is required.

To apply, please submit your application by May 28, 2018. Should you be contacted by TGLN, the initial communication will be sent via email. Please ensure that you provide an accessible email address with your submission.

Trillium Gift of Life Network thanks all applicants for their interest. However, only those applicants considered for this posting will be contacted.

title: Conseiller(ère) à la vente
Senior Project Manager, Highways
description:
Our Infrastructure Engineering group in Toronto is looking for a Senior Project Manager to join our growing team to lead complex Highway Engineering assignments.

Join our industry leading Infrastructure team
Seize the opportunity to work on major projects that improve the quality of life
Build stronger communities and grow your career in an environment that encourages innovation and delivers excellence
Work in challenging and rewarding roles in Canada’s greatest cities: Montreal, Vancouver or Toronto
The successful candidate will be responsible for managing projects and collaborating with other divisions to provide services in Highway Engineering. They will oversee project staff and sub-consultants and provide a leadership role in the Toronto civil engineering department’s mandate to build a strong team in this sector. They will be responsible for Business Development and proposal preparation for Highway Engineering projects with clients such as Ministry of Transportation of Ontario, 407 ETR Concession Company and municipalities in the GTHA.

Responsibilities

Direct and coordinate the activities of engineering and design groups
Assure compliance with project schedule, budget and procedures
Assure the delivery of quality products to clients
Liaise and coordinate with clients, stakeholders and sub-consultants
Assign and review work of subordinate staff
Review and approve project technical documentation, including drawings and specifications
Establish and maintain client contacts on technical and project administration matters
Prepare proposals and participate in business developments
Analyze problems and determine critical factors for investigation
Organize and conduct investigations and analyses
Provide expert advice on design processes and/or construction methods
Participate in the development of new engineering methods and technologies
Provide technical guidance and training to subordinate staff and co-workers
Propose staffing solutions, training and development opportunities
Organize and supervising work of a team of professionals and non-professionals
Assist Manager of the Roads & Highways group in staff management which may include annual performance evaluation of subordinate staff, budget review and forecast, and staff utilization
Be accountable for unit deliverables
Requirements

Registered or eligible for registration as a Professional Engineer in the Province of Ontario
Minimum 15 years of experience in highway design in a consultant environment
Strong organizational skill and proficiency in both oral and written communication in English
Self-starter, able to work with minimal direction and in an interactive team atmosphere
Familiar with manuals, design standards and guidelines of Ministry of Transportation Ontario, Transportation Association of Canada, Ontario Provincial Standards and Specifications, and other relevant local requirements
Experienced in project management, report and proposal writing.
Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite (Outlook, Word, Project, Excel, PowerPoint and Access)
Strong working knowledge in AutoCAD, MicroStation, CPS, HiCo and other design software, and related industry tools
Familiarity with civil engineering design tools such as InRoads, Civil 3D, and BIM is an asset
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, and ability to independently represent the design team to clients.
Demonstrated success in gaining regulatory approvals associated with infrastructure projects, including permitting with conservation authorities, road/rail authorities, and Ministry of Environment and Climate Change
Established relationships and proven track record with clients such as Ministry of Transportation; direct interaction with public sector clients such as Ministry of Transportation of Ontario in pursuing, winning and executing projects to their satisfaction
Appropriate accommodations will be provided upon request throughout the recruitment and hiring process as required by Company policy and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA).

Successful applicants will be notified about SNC-Lavalin’s accommodation policies at the time the employment offer is extended, and the information will be shared with new personnel during the onboarding process.

title: Loader/Unloader
description:

Job Description

Cintas is seeking a production Loader/Unloader. Cintas provides a variety of products to a large customer base each day. Those products include uniform garments, carpeted floor mats, heavy duty rubber floor mats, dust mops, shop towels, aprons, hand soap products and air freshener supplies. To load and unload the products results in repeated bending, stretching, twisting and lifting as well as standing for 3 to 7 hours a day. Responsibilities include driving the trucks around the lot and loading and unloading the uniform garments and/or additional facility services products into and out of company trucks. Daily accuracy of products loaded and unloaded is necessary for inventory control and accountability.

Required
Ability to meet the physical requirements of the position
Preferred

Education

None

Headquartered in Cincinnati, Cintas is a publicly held company traded over the Nasdaq Global Select Market under the symbol CTAS and is a component of both the Standard & Poor’s 500 Index and Nasdaq-100 Index.

Cintas Corporation helps more than 900,000 businesses of all types and sizes get READY™ to open their doors with confidence every day by providing a wide range of products and services that enhance our customers’ image and help keep their facilities and employees clean, safe and looking their best. With products and services including uniforms, mats, mops, restroom supplies, first aid and safety products, fire extinguishers and testing, and safety and compliance training, Cintas helps customers get Ready for the Workday®.

To support our growth across North America, we’re seeking driven professionals with ambition to move up within our company. Our professional culture, our dedication to our employee-partners and limitless career opportunities—these are just a few benefits we’re proud to offer. Our employee-partners know every job is critical, and that teamwork drives innovation. Are you Ready™ for limitless opportunities at Cintas?

title: Switchboard Operator PT - Commun.
description:
Switchboard Operator, Communications

Part-Time Position; Rotating 8 Hour Shifts

CUPE PT

Kingston General Hospital Site

DESCRIPTION:

The Switchboard Operator is responsible for the operation of the computerized switchboard for the provision of information and locating services to Hospital staff, patients and the public.

Within this role the employee is accountable for contributing to the delivery of the Kingston General Hospital strategy. As an employee, one must demonstrate an awareness of and be responsible for actively promoting and supporting patient and family centered engagement and care in all we do.

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBLITIES:
Provide telephone service to internal and external users by promptly answering all incoming calls, providing related information and transferring calls as requested. Including assisting callers making vague inquiries and directing them to the appropriate extension. Following on-call procedures for medical, administrative and technical staff.
Respond to emergency alarms and codes, carrying out procedures according to directives and ensure activities detailing incidents are documented as per requirements.
Place long distance calls for patients and personnel. Provide dialing instructions to staff, patients and public.
Update online on call application as required and provide support to administrative assistants on the entry and update of data into the electronic system.
Create and update non electronic on call lists
Daily check of each trunk to ensure users’ access, report irregularities to proper authorities. Send defective pagers for repair. Report telephone repairs. Testing of group pagers.
Assignment and testing of pager units.
Providing temporary pager and vocera units on an urgent basis
BASIC QUALIFICATIONS:
Grade 12 education or equivalent.
2 years’ experience on computerized switchboard console in a large institution at least 1 of which must have been in a Healthcare setting.
Keyboarding 35 wpm.
Demonstrated knowledge of Windows Applications including Word (Level 1), Excel (Level 1) and outlook. (All to be tested).
Excellent ability to communicate effectively in a courteous, tactful and professional manner with difficult situations/people.
Ability to listen, interpret and respond in an immediate fashion to emergencies using proper procedures.
Good organizational and problem solving skills required, including an ability to prioritize a varied and busy workload.
Proven ability to attend work regularly.
Satisfactory criminal record check required.
