title: Business Analyst (L3)
description:
About big river

big river technologies inc. is a nearshore software development company founded by an experienced team of technology and business experts. We are located in the beautiful 1000 islands region and offer a healthy balance between work and free-time lifestyles. We are growing quickly and are working with top Fortune 500 clients in our space. If you succeed in a fast-paced, self-starting and client-facing environment, working with the latest technologies on exciting projects, then we want to hear from you.

Job Description

We are looking for client-facing business analysts. Your primary focus will be to work with project stakeholders to document solution requirements, SLAs and NFRs, data flows and system functions (input, processing steps and output), define and document solution configurations and participate as needed in quality assurance activities. Your main duties will include working with the PMO, senior business analysts, clients, and a team of developers within an Agile based delivery model. A thorough technical understanding of SLAs and NFRs of all solution components is required.

Responsibilities
Analyze and create detailed business and/or technical requirements from a distillation of research on existing and future technical and business processes
Work with a team to deliver road maps, current state analyses, technical documents and diagrams
Research and/or interview stakeholders/SMEs, and, perform industry research
Perform in depth research of existing technical and business processes, and, create full documentation for future reference
Research data feeds and fields to develop an understanding of data formats, definitions, value and flows within systems
Help design, document and maintain system processes
Ensure the NFRs solution meets or exceeds proposed specifications
Analyze risks and constraints involved in proposed solutions, and obtain stakeholder buy in and signoff
Liaise with clients to socialize solution vision and results
Document test cases and develop reference/regression data sets
Coordinate workflow with designers and coders as needed
Report on common sources of technical issues or questions and make recommendations to product team
Communicate key insights and findings to product team
Track and document the decision-making process
Constantly be on the lookout for ways to improve monitoring, discover issues and deliver better value to the customer
Skills and Qualifications
Strong analytical, data and problem-solving skills
Exemplary written, verbal and presentation skills
Experienced in capturing and documenting solution requirements using Word, PowerPoint and Visio
Excellent relationship building skills with the ability to influence cross-functional teams
Mid-level knowledge of SQL
Self starter capable of working autonomously and within a team
Knowledge of QA best practices and commonly used techniques and tools useful in enterprise solution testing
Proficiency with modern test-driven development practices
Attention to detail
Stellar organizational skills and an ability to multi-task in a fast-paced environment
Experience working in an Agile team
A university degree in computer science or related discipline or equivalent
Desired Skills:
Capital Markets experience
Work Related Expectations

The incumbent will ideally be based out of our Gananoque office and must be willing to work flexible hours to accommodate client requirements in a variety of time zones. We service clients across North America, Europe and Asia/Pacific regions and vary our working hours accordingly.

big river tech is committed to employment equity and diversity and welcomes applications from women, visible minorities, aboriginal people, persons with disabilities and persons of any sexual orientation or gender. If any applicant requires accessibility assistance applying for open positions, please do not hesitate to contact us. Only those candidates for which an interview will be scheduled will be contacted.

title: Maintenance Supervisor
description:
Lafarge in Canada is proud to provide construction solutions in the buildings, infrastructure and industrial segments. These solutions are built with high performance products from our cement, aggregates, ready-mix concrete, asphalt and road construction, and concrete products divisions. From the use of alternative materials and recycling to renewable energy, Lafarge's focus is to develop innovative products that can contribute toward sustainablyconstructed building solutions. Lafarge takes personal growth and development to heart, and provides resources for our employees to take control of their own careers. Through our commitment to communities, to the health and safety of our employees and their families, or through the many volunteer hours of our employees, Lafarge demonstrates our care for people. If you want to work in an environment that values hard work, entrepreneurship, and collaborative teamwork, Lafarge is for you. Building Better Cities is what we do. Come Build a Better Careerwith us! More information can be found at www.lafarge-na.com/careers.

The prime objective of the Maintenance Supervisor is to oversee the completion of scheduled maintenance jobs using the highest level of quality, safety and effectiveness at minimum cost to maximize equipment availability and optimize reliability.

Key Responsibilities
To serve as a role model in the areas of safety, environmental stewardship, leadership, teamwork, customer focus, and continuous improvement to ensure alignment with the company’s vision and critical success factors.
Ensure the safe and effective operation of the maintenance unit.
Be familiar with and support the plant's Environmental Management System including being aware of any specific duties outlined in the program.
Minimize frequency & severity of accidents of maintenance personnel and contractors via risk identification process.
Provide a work environment that promotes individual growth.
Review of weekly schedule and address concerns with Maintenance Manager.
Assign and review work to perform with millwrights. Maintain schedule priority and compliance.
Review job cleanliness requirements and review with Production weekly after schedule posting.
Complete maintenance related jobs according to the highest standards of safety, efficiency and effectiveness.
Streamline job execution and associated repair costs.
Ensure, upon completion of repairs, that equipment is in good operating condition, ready to meet operational requirements, completed alarm reviews, safe and job site is clean.
Respond to emergency breakdowns to ensure prompt repairs.
Provide reporting to the Maintenance Manager and feedback to millwrights on repair jobs including consumption of materials, tools, man hours & skill.
Review equipment history files and ensure properly recorded histories in work order completions in the maintenance management module
Continuously report on maintenance performance during major overhauls and recommend corrective actions to maintain the department budget and schedule.
Responsible to develop and execute part of the annual training plan for all millwrights.
Results/Accountabilities
Provide a safe working environment for all employees.
Supervise millwrights as well as contractors when required to complement work crews.
Administer the terms and conditions of the Collective Agreement in a fair, firm, and consistent manner. Provide grievance counseling as required.
Completion of work orders as per weekly schedule in the maintenance management module. Reassign work as per plant priorities and emergencies.
Ensure that maintenance activities comply with all legislated regulations and corporate policies.
Promote good relations and communication between the maintenance and production departments.
Ensure productivity, housekeeping and quality of work standards are maintained within the mechanical maintenance department.
Aim to achieve 98% reliability on all major pieces of equipment.
Achieve personal and departmental goals.
Participate in the plant “On-Call” system.
Investigate, report, provide and implement corrective actions for all safety incidents and near misses.
Responsible for the maintenance and reliability of all plant mobile equipment.
Provide weekly budget statistics to the Maintenance Manager.
Coordinate training for the millwrights including the mentoring of millwright apprentices.
Relationships with Others’ Jobs:

The Maintenance Supervisor reports to the Maintenance Manager. Maintenance Mechanics (Millwrights) report to the Maintenance Supervisor.

Dimensions:

Plant annual capacity: 1,000,000mt

Annual maintenance Budget: $10,000,000

Staff reports: 0

Hourly direct reports: 19

Education and Work Experience:

Mandatory skills:
Bachelor of Mechanical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering Technologist, or equivalent field experience.
Optimize skills adequacy to jobs and ensure the transfer of technical know-how.
Proven experience in executing major work and plant shutdowns
Knowledge of labor law and personnel management rules.
Work quality control, analysis of execution modes and identification of improvements.
Experience with Computerized Mechanical Maintenance System (CMMS) and the maintenance management module in SAP.
Strong communicator (both oral & written).
Excellent interpersonal skills with demonstrated ability to interact with plant personnel.
Highly motivated with ability to work with minimal supervision.
Demonstrated commitment to achieving organizational and personal goals.
Preferred skills:

The incumbent will be able to demonstrate the following characteristics:
Extensive experience in heavy equipment repair; experience in inspection an asset.
In depth knowledge of preventative and predictive maintenance.
Proven ability to work well in a team environment (co-workers, contractors, etc.)
Well organized and systematic.
Lominger Competencies:
Action Oriented
Conflict Management
Customer Focus
Informing
Organizing
Planning
Priority Setting
Problem Solving

title: Operations Manager
description:
Position Summary:

Cardinal Health Canada is currently seeking a Manufacturing Operations Manager for an immediate need within our Gananoque facility. This position will report directly to the Manufacturing Director. He or she will manage all the planning and coordination of manufacturing operations involving safety, quality, production, staffing, continuous improvement and OEE in a highly regulated manufacturing facility. The selected candidate will provide strong leadership all while passionately guiding a strategic vision, day-to-day operations and long-term growth objectives.

Key Responsibilities
Provides operational and technical management support to the operations and other support groups
Performs tasks related to product and process standards, production and human resources planning, capital projects and process design, start-up and modification
Identifies and supports projects for the site and prioritizes based on safety, quality, customer service and cost reduction needs
Provides support and expert advice, guidance and mentoring to the business
Supports OH&S policies, procedures, guidelines and employee training requirements
Assists in design, maintenance and interpretation of performance measurement systems
Promotes, leads and fosters a positive safety and quality culture within the organization
Provides assistance and expertise on plants total maintenance excellence program
Oversees planning and forecasting and monitors financials
Supports process and continuous improvement initiatives
Experience and Knowledge
Degree in Engineering and/or Business
Minimum of 10+ years manufacturing management experience
Minimum of 7+ years experience in managing medium to large teams
Experience in a regulatory environment is an asset
Lean Manufacturing and Six Sigma certification and experience considered an asset
Strong planning and execution skills
Working knowledge of Quality Management, Auditing, Engineering, and ISO
Sound analytical thinking, planning, prioritization and execution skills
Ability to lead and manage cross-functional teams
An adaptable, inclusive, respectful and value-driven professional
Cardinal Health is committed to employment equity and encourages applications from women, visible minorities, Aboriginal peoples and persons with disabilities. Cardinal Health is committed to accommodating applicants with disabilities throughout the hiring process, in accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA). Our Human Resources team is responsible for working with applicants requesting an accommodation at any stage of the hiring process.

Cardinal Health is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status.

title: Process Engineer - LLDP: Leadership Roles for upcoming graduates and recent graduates highly preferred!!
description:
Why work for Lafarge?
Lafarge in Canada is proud to provide construction solutions in the buildings, infrastructure and industrial segments. These solutions are built with high performance products from our cement, aggregates, ready-mix concrete, asphalt and road construction, and concrete products divisions. From the use of alternative materials and recycling to renewable energy, Lafarge's focus is to develop innovative products that can contribute toward sustainablyconstructed building solutions. Lafarge takes personal growth and development to heart, and provides resources for our employees to take control of their own careers. Through our commitment to communities, to the health and safety of our employees and their families, or through the many volunteer hours of our employees, Lafarge demonstrates our care for people. If you want to work in an environment that values hard work, entrepreneurship, and collaborative teamwork, Lafarge is for you. Building Better Cities is what we do. Come Build a Better Careerwith us! More information can be found at www.lafarge.ca/en/careers .
Overview
Please note that these job postings are specifically for upcoming gradutes finishing their degree/diploma in May 2018 OR for those who have graduated university within the last 2 years. We will not consider your application unless you meet this very important requirement for these particular roles.
Lafarge Leadership Development Program (LLDP)
The Lafarge Leadership Development Program offers qualified individuals an opportunity to work through developmental roles over a term of 18-24 months. The positions are designed to maximize your personal and professional learning and development. Each LLDP path is different, and custom designed for you!
Currently, we are looking for recent graduates who seek the challenge of a hands-on work environment that will provide industry knowledge and skills to drive your career path forward. We are looking for individuals who are interested in the areas of development, leadership and management of operational functions and performance throughout Eastern Canada.
To be considered for an LLDP role, qualified candidates must have a College/University degree, be willing to relocate within eastern Canada, be analytical, entrepreneurial and have highly developed communication skills. All of this must be coupled with a strong drive to gain business knowledge and a willingness to experience a variety of positions within the organization.
Responsibilities
Position Summary:
The prime objective is to troubleshoot process-related problems and to ensure continuous optimization of all stages of the cement manufacturing process. In addition, the process engineer works with various other departments to identify and develop long-term improvements as well as working with the technical centers to ensure that the Lafarge technical doctrines are implemented at the plant level.
Responsibilities:
To serve as a role model in the areas of safety, environmental stewardship, leadership, teamwork, customer focus, and continuous improvement to ensure alignment with the company’s vision and critical success factors.
Be familiar with and support the plant's ISO 14001 Environmental Management System including being aware of any specific duties outlined in the program.
In consultation with the Environmental Manager, ensure that all regulatory requirements associated with the carrying out of operational duties are completed as required by the relevant regulation, Certificate, or permit.
Ensure that any changes to the plant's equipment or design are reviewed with the Environmental Manager to ensure that any relevant regulatory requirements are identified and met.
Conduct duties to ensure that the goals of the Environmental Policy are met
Optimize the day to day operations of the cement manufacturing process.
Provide technical support to various plant personnel.
Manage the process equipment inventory.
Manage process best practices as they become available to the plant.
Continuous monitoring of base line process information using procedures and schedule.
Perform process audits as per Lafarge standards.
Maintain accurate and complete process records
Determine areas for significant process improvements and assist with the implementation of such projects
Results/Accountabilities:
Contribute to the analysis of equipment breakdown and non-optimal running
Define and implement improvements to existing process and optimal solutions to process problems
Ensure permanent monitoring of key process and operation parameters & data, inspection of stopped equipment and organize process reviews
Contribute to new technology /new processes /new product development
Keep track of trials, process activities, solutions tested and process inspections
Ensure progress in process control loop and automation
Relationships with Others’ Jobs:
The Process Engineer reports to the Process Manager. There are no direct reports.
Qualifications
You must be a recent university or college graduate within the last 2 years OR you will be completing your degree/diploma May 2018.
Education and Work Experience:
Bachelor’s degree in engineering (chemical or mechanical preferred)
Complete understanding of cement manufacturing process
Preferred skills:
Technical background that includes mass transport and thermodynamics
Advanced computer skills
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
The incumbent will be able to demonstrate the following characteristics:
Lominger Competencies:
Action Oriented
Conflict Management
Creativity
Customer Focus
Decision Quality
Informing
Organizing
Planning
Priority Setting
Problem Solving
LafargeHolcim
Why work for us?
Working for Lafarge offers a wide variety of career opportunities that utilize your abilities and skills to contribute to a better world. In addition to local and global developmental opportunities, we provide employees with competitive compensation, a comprehensive benefits plan, a health & wellness program with financial incentives, an extensive global e-learning platform and much more! More information can be found at:
www.lafarge.ca

title: Python Developer
description:
About Big River

Big River Technologies Inc., is a startup nearshore software development company founded by an experienced team of technology and business experts. Our mission is to provide our clients with the highest level of custom software development expertise available at an affordable cost. We help our customers "build better solutions, faster and cheaper" and to do this we are launching our nearshore design center in Eastern Ontario, in the heart of the beautiful 1000 Islands region. Our focus is in developing interactive user experiences using Angular, HTML5 and the latest big data technologies. We are technical. We are creative. We are Agile.

Job Description

We are looking for talented Python Developers to join our team. Your primary focus will be to implement complete user experiences to server side functionality, depending on your skills and interests. Your main duties will include creating modules and components and coupling them together into a functional application. The artistic design will be delivered to you, together with a few HTML templates, but we will ask for your help in regard to animations, CSS, and final HTML output. You will work in a team with back-end developers, and communicate with the API using standard methods.

Training programs are available and salary is commensurate with experience. We have roles for recent graduates up to intermediate and senior developers.

Responsibilities
Design, develop, test, deploy, maintain, and enhance software solutions in a team environment
Build new features, trouble shoot software issues and implement bug fixes in Python
Delivering a complete front end application
Writing tested, idiomatic, and documented Python, JavaScript, Java, HTML and CSS
Skills and Qualifications
Proficiency with Python, Java, JavaScript and HTML5
Exemplary communication skills
Team player
Experience working in an Agile team is highly desirable
Knowledge of AngularJS practices and commonly used modules and tools that compose the ecosystem
Creating self-contained, reusable, and testable modules and components
Ability to provide SEO solutions for single page apps is a plus
Validating user actions on the client side and providing responsive feedback
Writing non-blocking code, and resorting to advanced techniques such as multi-threading, when needed
Experience with all levels of operation available to the front-end, such as from creating XHRs in vanilla JS to using a custom wrapper around $resource
Experience with building the infrastructure for serving the front-end app and assets
Architecting and automating the build process for production, using task runners or scripts
Documenting the code inline using JSDoc or other conventions
Writing extensive automated Business Driven Development tests based on user stories and Gherkins and running them with testing tools such as jBehave, Cucumber or Protractor (or a well-reasoned alternative)
Creating configuration, build, and test scripts for Continuous Integration environments
A university degree in computer science or related discipline or equivalent
Work Related Expectations

The incumbents must be willing to work flexible hours to accommodate client requirements in the time zone of their choice. We service clients across North America, Europe and Asia/Pacific regions and vary our working hours accordingly.

title: Retail General Manager - Retail Manager - Retail Assistant Manager
description:
Drive your Future!
Pilot Flying J is seeking an experienced Retail General Manager to oversee our high-volume retail facilities. You will be responsible for the generation and execution of travel center and restaurant business plans to achieve established standards, sales and profit objectives as well as customer satisfaction.

The Retail General Manager will also be:
Ensuring that customer expectations are met
Conducting meetings with subordinate employees
Maintaining effective vendor relationships
As a Retail General Manager for Pilot Flying J, you will build, coach, manage and develop teams from a staffing, interviewing, hiring and training standpoint.

Additional responsibilities for the Retail General Manager include:
Driving sales
Managing team members
Tracking inventory
Providing customer service
Performing P&L analysis
What Are We Looking For?

As a Retail General Manager, you must exemplify integrity and accountability at the managerial level as well as demonstrate excellent team leadership skills. Furthermore, you must be able to work a flexible schedule of nights, days, weekends and holidays.

Additional requirements of the Restaurant General Manager include:
Minimum 2-3 years of management experience in the retail, restaurant, grocery or other service industry with responsibility for financial results
Previous management proficiency in high volume retail with P&L accountability
Ability to create and maintain a customer focused culture
Benefits:

Compensation Commensurate with Experience
Weekly Pay
Relocation Assistance
Profit Sharing
Extended Health Care Benefits
Dental Insurance
Life Insurance
AD&D Insurance

title: Sales Associate - Outlet Collection at Niagara
description:

title: Maintenance Engineer - This is a developmental role - Recent graduates high preferred!!
description:
Why work for Lafarge?
Lafarge in Canada is proud to provide construction solutions in the buildings, infrastructure and industrial segments. These solutions are built with high performance products from our cement, aggregates, ready-mix concrete, asphalt and road construction, and concrete products divisions. From the use of alternative materials and recycling to renewable energy, Lafarge's focus is to develop innovative products that can contribute toward sustainablyconstructed building solutions. Lafarge takes personal growth and development to heart, and provides resources for our employees to take control of their own careers. Through our commitment to communities, to the health and safety of our employees and their families, or through the many volunteer hours of our employees, Lafarge demonstrates our care for people. If you want to work in an environment that values hard work, entrepreneurship, and collaborative teamwork, Lafarge is for you. Building Better Cities is what we do. Come Build a Better Careerwith us! More information can be found at www.lafarge.ca/en/careers .
Overview
Please note that these job postings are specifically for upcoming gradutes finishing their degree/diploma in May 2018 OR for those who have graduated university within the last 2 years. We will not consider your application unless you meet this very important requirement for these particular roles.
Lafarge Leadership Development Program (LLDP)
The Lafarge Leadership Development Program offers qualified individuals an opportunity to work through developmental roles over a term of 18-24 months. The positions are designed to maximize your personal and professional learning and development. Each LLDP path is different, and custom designed for you!
Currently, we are looking for recent graduates who seek the challenge of a hands-on work environment that will provide industry knowledge and skills to drive your career path forward. We are looking for individuals who are interested in the areas of development, leadership and management of operational functions and performance throughout Eastern Canada.
To be considered for an LLDP role, qualified candidates must have a College/University degree, be willing to relocate within eastern Canada, be analytical, entrepreneurial and have highly developed communication skills. All of this must be coupled with a strong drive to gain business knowledge and a willingness to experience a variety of positions within the organization.
Responsibilities
Objective:
The Maintenance Engineer’s, primary objective is to deliver a high level of equipment reliability and availability through the introduction and development of maintenance prevention processes and engineering practices. Implement new concepts and proven tools that will deliver higher reliability and performance. Develop and maintain standardized KPIs to evaluate the plant’s performance and recommend improvements. Improve the uptime and productive capacity of critical equipment using formalized problem-solving techniques. In addition, the Maintenance Engineer will provide technical mechanical assistance for the Plant team. When required, the Maintenance Engineer will assume the responsibilities of a Maintenance Supervisor and lead mechanical repair staff. Furthermore, the incumbent will define and implement capital projects within the capital budget plan in order to improve the plant’s operation and keep the Bath plant in a long-term competitive position.
Responsibilities:
To serve as a role model in the areas of safety, environmental stewardship, leadership, teamwork, customer focus, and continuous improvement to ensure alignment with the company’s vision and critical success factors.
Assist in developing, recommending and managing process & equipment reliability programs (Root cause failure analysis/ Mean Time Between Failure)
Perform studies to ensure the overall reliability and capacity of the mills through product quality standards, equipment specific specifications and requirements compliance.
Work with supervisors of maintenance (mechanical and electrical) to ensure optimal performance and efficiency of maintenance activities (mechanical & electrical)
Identify and manage asset reliability/ risks that could adversely affect business operations
Plan and Execute Reliability Improvement Projects specifically intended to support Production to incrementally improve plant performance.
Review engineering specifications/drawings and propose design modifications to improve reliability within cost and other performance requirements
Monitor equipment performance and evaluate equipment history and failure trends to determine sources of poor component performance
Evaluate equipment failure modes and utilize engineering experience and training to develop solutions for eliminating/mitigating potential failure(s)
Provide or obtain technical expertise to assist the production, process, and maintenance departments in the optimization of equipment.
The Maintenance Engineer with the input of plant personnel will assist in planning and implementing capital projects with minimum supervision.
Interface with vendors, contractors, and engineering firms on proposal for design and execution of projects in all the technical aspects, bearing in mind the safety aspects.
Coordinate the system start-up and commissioning along with the plant people; assists in the resolution of any contract disputes; organize proper training when required.
Contribute to maintaining and updating the long-term plan, which provides the medium to long term direction for the plant; maintain a continual awareness of project status and cost.
Perform a contributing role in developing spare parts lists; coordinate development of specifications for mechanical and electrical disciplines.
Relationship with other jobs:
Works closely with the maintenance team and more specifically with the electrical maintenance individual associated with the active projects.
Works closely with the Process / System / Production teams.
Dimensions:
Plant Capacity: 1,000,000mt cement
Number of Direct Reports: 0
Specific Accountabilities:
Provide a safe working environment for all employees and contractors.
Ensure that projects comply with all legislated regulations and corporate policies.
Successfully complete projects on time and within budget, with effective use of resources.
Ensure productivity, housekeeping and quality of work standards are maintained on all projects.
Aim to achieve targeted reliability on all major equipment through recommendations and the installation new equipment.
Achieve personal and departmental goals
Qualifications
A mechanical engineering degree or technical college diploma/degree or equivalent combination of technical training and/or related experience
Familiarized with automated drafting software (ex.: Autocad)
Knowledge of project management procedures, cost control, and scheduling.
Ability to work on many tasks at the same time while keeping excellent organizational skills.
Good leadership ability and interpersonal skills.
Knowledge of the cement technology and manufacturing is an asset.
LafargeHolcim
Why work for us?
Working for Lafarge offers a wide variety of career opportunities that utilize your abilities and skills to contribute to a better world. In addition to local and global developmental opportunities, we provide employees with competitive compensation, a comprehensive benefits plan, a health & wellness program with financial incentives, an extensive global e-learning platform and much more! More information can be found at:
www.lafarge.ca
We thank you for your interest. Only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted. Lafarge is committed to the principles of employment equity and encourages the applications from women, visible minorities, and persons with disabilities.

title: Scheduler
description:
Scheduler
Black & McDonald Limited - Napanee, Ontario
Posted:Friday August 25 2017

Job Description

Page Content
People:Our Strength, Our Future

A career at Black & McDonald will grant you the opportunity to contribute to our culture of continuous improvement, help reinforce our values and shape our contribution to community, and drive our continued success. Our vision is to be the best company to work for; the best company for safety, quality and value; the best company for customer service; and the best company for technical expertise.

Position Summary

Black & McDonald is actively seeking a Scheduler for the TransCanada Energy Ltd. Napanee Generating Station (NGS) Project located in Napanee, Ontario. The successful candidate will co-ordinate and expedite the flow of work and materials, prepare work and production schedules and monitor the progress of production. Emphasis is placed on reporting and monitoring, planning and scheduling, and dealing with project change, and assisting the Project Manager, as requested.

Duties & Responsibilities
To plan, in conjunction with the Project Manager, Pre-Planning/Pre-Construction Services.
To provide technical and administrative support to the projects operations with emphasis on reporting, planning and monitoring progress, and scheduling, and dealing with project change.
Consult with supervisor to schedule work sites in a cost and time-efficient manner
Meet regularly with supervisors to co-ordinate activities at project sites
Prepare and maintain various reports on the progress of work and materials used.
Provide support to cost control, document control and change order control
Prepare progress reports and issue progress schedules to clients

Desired Skills & Experience

Job Skills
Competency Requirements
Change Orientation
Communicates Effectively
Continuous Learning
Customer Focus
Holds Self and Others Accountable
Problem Solving and Innovation
Teamwork and Collaboration
Values and Respects Others

Education & Skill Requirements
College Diploma or University Degree in Project Management would be an asset
Minimum 2 years experience in project scheduling
Knowledge ofConstruction Cycle
Proficient with Primavera P6 and Microsoft Project
Able to read / interpret Electrical drawings

Company Description

In 1921, William J. McDonald and William R. Black formed Black & McDonald Limited,
a partnership to engage in residential wiring. Throughout the years, Black & McDonald has remained a
family-owned business with an uncompromising commitment to the founder's principles of delivery as
promised and fairness to all. The company has followed a planned course of diversification and expansion,
combining growth and financial stability with ongoing investment in our people, and a willingness to pioneer
new business opportunities and directions. Black & McDonald is an integrated, multi-trade contractor
providing electrical, mechanical, utility and maintenance services to government, industrial, commercial
and institutional markets. Currently, Black & McDonald operates across Canada, US and Bermuda.
The company has over 5,500 employees working out of a network of more than 26 offices.

Black & McDonald approaches accessibility from an inclusive perspective, and will provide reasonable accommodation upon request throughout the recruitment and selection process.

description:
Location:
Lansdowne/Gananoque, Ontario, Canada

Job Category:
Customer Service

Job Type:
Part Time

The LCBO is currently accepting applications for Part-time Customer Service Representatives to work in LCBO�s retail store in Lansdowne/ Gananoque.

Part-time Customer Service Representatives are expected to serve customers promptly, courteously and responsibly and in addition to interacting with customers, your responsibilities will include unloading trucks; handling stock; and operating computerized cash registers. Physical tasks include repetitive moving and lifting of bottles varying in weight, and lifting cases weighing up to 60 lbs/28 kg; standing for extended periods of time and being able to reach, climb, bend, twist and walk.

Hours available to casual employees will depend on the operational requirements for each store and are scheduled in accordance with the collective agreement based on an employee�s seniority and availability. Customer Service Representatives are usually assigned to work during our peak periods (evening and weekend shifts), or whenever extra help is required. You must be available for work during peak business periods (i.e. Christmas, tourist periods, etc.). Hours are not guaranteed, but are scheduled in advance by the store manager. However, on occasion, you may be called in to work on short notice.

Applicants will be required to provide an original criminal record check at their own expense prior to commencing work with LCBO. The criminal record check document must have been issued no more than six (6) months prior to first day of employment. Criminal record checks can be obtained by attending your local police department, or by using an online platform provided by a third-party supplier like Sterling Talent Solutions/mybackcheck.com.

Process with Local Police:
If you choose to attend a local police department to procure your criminal record check, please be aware that pricing and processing time will vary by location.

Online Process with Sterling Talent Solutions/mybackcheck.com :
Criminal record checks obtained through Sterling Talent Solutions/mybackcheck.com are completed online and results are returned usually within one business day. To complete your check online, please visit the website https://www.sterlingtalentsolutions.ca/landing-pages/l/lcbo-retail-stores/
Please note that LCBO is not responsible for applicants� use of any third party supplier of criminal record checks.

The LCBO is dedicated to hiring a diverse, productive workforce, and each year we receive a strong response for part-time employment. Opportunities for positions are limited due to low turnover rates in our stores.

title: Store Manager - PartSource - Gananoque
description:
PartSource is a chain of automotive parts specialty stores that offer brand-name auto parts to the medium to heavy ‘do-it-yourselfers,’ automotive enthusiasts and commercial installers.

As part of Canadian Tire Corporation’s growing network of interrelated businesses, PartSource employees are committed to ensuring that our commercial and retail customers enjoy a memorable customer experience. In return, our investment in our people includes a comprehensive total rewards package, including store discount programs and opportunities for career development.

Position Summary

The Store Manager is responsible for maximizing the net profit of their location by effective management of all functions in the store and building, developing, and leading a high performing team. This is accomplished through ensuring optimal customer experiences, maximizing sales, expense and cost management, store presentation, and protection of company assets. The Store Manager is also a service provider to both the internal and an external customer base.

Customer Service

· Builds a Sales Obsessed Culture by providing an exceptional in store customer experience

· Responsible to drive outside sales through commercial accounts, new businesses prospecting and exceptional management of customer relationship with CTR dealer partners

Operations:

· Delegates and follows up on execution of PS visual compliance standards, store maintenance and pricing standards.

· Establishes plan and follows up on execution of price changes.

· Leads execution of planograms, and merchandising directives.

· Responsible for managing / minimizing store shrink through team awareness, enforcement of audit compliance and standards and rigid inventory control.

· Ensures accurate execution and completes daily review of shipping /receiving/ returns processing and documentation according to company policies.

·
Oversees preparation for annual inventories.

· Follows and ensures compliance of all Cash and Audit, and OH&S policies and procedures.

· Creates and / or monitors the creation of efficient store weekly scheduling for both sales and support functions.

· Responsible for overall Store and equipment maintenance and compliance for PS fleet, using FOS fleet management maintenance system, driver compliance, and appropriate certifications for all roles.

· Manages regular reconciliations and collections of accounts payable balances for all customer business accounts.

Training

· Coaches and develops store and management team, through setting expectations, communication, coaching, feedback and ongoing support

· Sets and follows up on individual and store sales goals

· Creates development plans and conducts annual appraisals for store team; support and coach to improve any performance gaps, and conducts ongoing coaching to improve team.

·
Communicates in a clear and concise manner to team, leading effective huddles / meetings / coaching sessions, keeping team well informed of pertinent information.

· Completes and holds team accountable to complete required training, i.e. health and safety, assigned CTU modules, within required timeframes.

· Facilitates and leads team meetings.

· Ensures execution of the Customer Experience, and provides resolution for all customer concerns.

· Develops and leads recruiting and hiring strategy for store, maintains a complete team, adhering to IBO standards.

· Creates succession plans through continuous training and development

Leadership

· Provides mentorship to teams and influences continuous growth.

· Continually motivates team and performance through recognition programs, in store contests, customer compliments, etc.

·
Fosters positive and productive partnership with Commercial sales team to drive customer base and increase sales and profitability.

· Maintain PS performance expectations (feedback/coaching); this includes progressive discipline where necessary.

· Follows the disciplinary process consistently and impartially.

· Promotes and maintains a positive and motivating work environment.

Deliverables

· Achieves personal sales goals and drives store sales

· Store Sales at or above budget

· Shrink at or below target

· Payroll at or below budgeted pay "

·
Expenses at or below budgeted "

· Achievement of 95" on Store Audits

What you bring.

· Proven ability to coach, mentor and develop department team and store team, through setting expectations, communication, coaching, feedback and ongoing support

· Proven ability to build and manage a daily game plan for the department and store

· Exceptional communication skills

· Excellent organizational skills

· Superior training and mentoring skills

· 3-5 years retail experience managing a multi-channel business required

·
Managing and growing B2B business sales

· High energy, enthusiasm and a drive to succeed

· Fundamental computer skills an asset

· Able to work retail hours including scheduled evenings, weekends and holidays

What you’ll get

· Competitive salary

· Competitive bonus program

· Comprehensive Benefit package

· Employee Preferred Pricing on Hard Parts

·
Fun, fast paced environment with like-minded people

· Opportunity to combine your passion for automotive with your love of retail.

Background Check Requirements:

As a condition of employment, this position is subject to the successful completion of the following pre-employment conditions:
Employment Verifications
Criminal Background Check
We thank all applicants for their interest; however only those candidates elected for an interview will be contacted. Alternatively, email your resume and cover letter to careers@partsource.ca.

PartSource is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace for all. We recognize that our future success depends on the perspectives and contributions of all our employees -- their diverse backgrounds, abilities and experiences make our business stronger. If you are contacted for a job opportunity, please advise us of any accommodations needed to ensure fair and equitable access throughout the recruitment and selection process. All accommodation information provided will be treated as confidential and used only for the purpose of providing an accessible candidate experience.

title: Mobile Native iOS/Android Developers
description:
About Big River

Big River Technologies Inc., is a nearshore software development company founded by an experienced team of technology and business experts. We are located in the beautiful 1000 islands region and offer a healthy balance between work and free-time lifestyles. We are growing quickly and are working with top Fortune 500 clients in our space. If you succeed in a fast-paced, self-starting and client-facing environment, working with the latest technologies on exciting projects, then we want to hear from you.

Job Description

We are looking for client-facing Native Android & iOS Developers to provide state of the art world leading reactive interfaces on mobile devices.

Training programs are available and salary is commensurate with experience.

Responsibilities
Work as part of an Agile team, building, testing and deploying native applications on iOS and Android platforms
Skills and Qualifications
Android Widgets and widget configuration
Android application packaging (apps and widgets together)
iOS Widgets
iOS Touch/Face ID authentication
iOS/Android Widgets that use external data feeds
iOS Widget/App interoperability (opening apps from widgets)
iOS Widget configuration
Exemplary communication skills
Team player
Experience working in an Agile team
A university degree in computer science or related discipline or equivalent
Work Related Expectations

The incumbent will ideally be based out of our Gananoque office and must be willing to work flexible hours to accommodate client requirements in a variety of time zones. We service clients across North America, Europe and Asia/Pacific regions and vary our working hours accordingly.

title: Junior Developer (L2)
description:
About Big River

Big River Technologies Inc., is a nearshore software development company founded by an experienced team of technology and business experts. We are located in the beautiful 1000 islands region and offer a healthy balance between work and free-time lifestyles. We are growing quickly and are working with top Fortune 500 clients in our space. If you succeed in a fast-paced, self-starting and client-facing environment, working with the latest technologies on exciting projects, then we want to hear from you.

Job Description

We are looking for client-facing Junior Developers, with development skills in technologies such as Java, JavaScript, Angular, and React. Ultimately, we look for bright, hard-working, fun individuals who have a passion for solving problems. Strong leaders desiring to work in a collaborative, multidisciplinary environment and deliver extraordinary results for our clients will find the greatest success at big river.

As a Junior Developer, you will constantly learn new leadership, business, and technical skills and use these skills to implement critical business solutions for our clients. You will work with clients who are as excited as you are about reshaping their world. And, you will have unlimited opportunities to develop your leadership potential and build quality relationships with colleagues and clients.

Training programs are available and salary is commensurate with experience.

Responsibilities
Working with a team to deliver a fully functional and testable application
Ensuring the solution NFRs meet or exceed proposed specifications
Writing tested, idiomatic, and documented code, HTML and CSS
Coordinating the workflow between designers, other coders, and yourself
Building RESTful APIs
Communicating with external web services
Skills and Qualifications
Knowledge of multiple technologies (Java, JavaScript, HTML5, ReactJS, AngularJS, .NET, Salesforce)
Exemplary communication skills
Team player
Experience working in an Agile team is highly desirable
Creating self-contained, reusable, and testable modules and components
Thorough understanding of the responsibilities of the platform, database, API, caching layer, proxies, and other web services used in the system
Writing extensive automated Business Driven Development tests based on user stories and Gherkins and running them with testing tools such as jBehave, Cucumber or Protractor (or a well-reasoned alternative)
Creating configuration, build, and test scripts for Continuous Integration environments
A university degree in computer science or related discipline or equivalent
Experience in systems integration, software development, package implementation, and/or interactive design.
Ability to define, create and complete a task without a great deal of guidance.
Ability to be creative and innovative, and work well independently and as a team player in a fast-paced consulting environment.
Work Related Expectations

The incumbent will ideally be based out of our Gananoque office, and must be willing to work flexible hours to accommodate client requirements in the time zone of their choice. We service clients across North America, Europe and Asia/Pacific regions and vary our working hours accordingly.

title: Store Manager - PartSource - Gananoque
description:
PartSource is a chain of automotive parts specialty stores that offer brand-name auto parts to the medium to heavy ‘do-it-yourselfers,’ automotive enthusiasts and commercial installers.

As part of Canadian Tire Corporation’s growing network of interrelated businesses, PartSource employees are committed to ensuring that our commercial and retail customers enjoy a memorable customer experience. In return, our investment in our people includes a comprehensive total rewards package, including store discount programs and opportunities for career development.

Position Summary

The Store Manager is responsible for maximizing the net profit of their location by effective management of all functions in the store and building, developing, and leading a high performing team. This is accomplished through ensuring optimal customer experiences, maximizing sales, expense and cost management, store presentation, and protection of company assets. The Store Manager is also a service provider to both the internal and an external customer base.

title: Junior Business Analyst (L2)
description:
About big river

big river technologies inc. is a nearshore software development company founded by an experienced team of technology and business experts. We are located in the beautiful 1000 islands region and offer a healthy balance between work and free-time lifestyles. We are growing quickly and are working with top Fortune 500 clients in our space. If you succeed in a fast-paced, self-starting and client-facing environment, working with the latest technologies on exciting projects, then we want to hear from you.

Job Description

We are looking for entry-level client-facing business analysts. Your primary focus will be to work with project stakeholders to document solution requirements, SLAs and NFRs, data flows and system functions (input, processing steps and output), document solution configurations and participate as needed in quality assurance activities. Your main duties will include working with the PMO, senior business analysts, clients, and a team of developers within an Agile based delivery model.

Responsibilities
Analyze and create detailed business and/or technical requirements from a distillation of research on existing and future technical and business processes
Work with a team to deliver road maps, current state analyses, technical documents and diagrams
Research and/or interview stakeholders/SMEs, and, perform industry research
Perform in depth research of existing technical and business processes, and, create full documentation for future reference
Research data feeds and fields to develop an understanding of data formats, definitions, value and flows within systems
Help design, document and maintain system processes
Ensure the NFRs solution meets or exceeds proposed specifications
Analyze risks and constraints involved in proposed solutions, and obtain stakeholder buy in and signoff
Liaise with clients to socialize solution vision and results
Document test cases and develop reference/regression data sets
Coordinate workflow with designers and coders as needed
Report on common sources of technical issues or questions and make recommendations to product team
Communicate key insights and findings to product team
Track and document the decision-making process
Constantly be on the lookout for ways to improve monitoring, discover issues and deliver better value to the customer
Skills and Qualifications
Strong analytical, data and problem-solving skills
Exemplary written, verbal and presentation skills
Experienced in capturing and documenting solution requirements using Word, PowerPoint and Visio
Excellent relationship building skills with the ability to influence cross-functional teams
Self starter capable of working autonomously and within a team
Proficiency with modern test-driven development practices
Attention to detail
Stellar organizational skills and an ability to multi-task in a fast-paced environment
Experience working in an Agile team is desriable
A university degree in computer science or related discipline or equivalent
Work Related Expectations

The incumbent will ideally be based out of our Gananoque office and must be willing to work flexible hours to accommodate client requirements in a variety of time zones. We service clients across North America, Europe and Asia/Pacific regions and vary our working hours accordingly.

big river tech is committed to employment equity and diversity and welcomes applications from women, visible minorities, aboriginal people, persons with disabilities and persons of any sexual orientation or gender. If any applicant requires accessibility assistance applying for open positions, please do not hesitate to contact us. Only those candidates for which an interview will be scheduled will be contacted.

title: Merchandiser
description:
Merchandising Specialist Opportunity For Major CPG Client

About the Position

Brand
Momentum is currently looking for a detail orientated and experienced
Merchandising Specialist to work independently at one to two retail locations,
up to 32 hours per week, from May till December.

About Brand Momentum

We
are a national integrated Sales, Marketing, and Retail solutions agency with
two headquarters, one in Toronto and one in Montreal. We deliver authentic and
enduring human connections, and we are led by a talented team and supported by
a network of trusted partners. Rooted in Goodness, Brand Momentum is a
three-time winner of Canadas top 100 Best Workplace® and one of Canadas top
500 fastest growing companies.

About Our Culture

Goodness
is at the heart of everything we do. Brand Momentum (BMI) is an enduring market
leader in quality and innovation. We deliver on our promises to our clients and
each other, and we do it with passion, innovation and a commitment to
excellence. Every single day we live our values of integrity, respect,
empowerment, commitment, fun, flexibility and fiscal responsibility while
putting our valued clients at the center of every decision we make.

About You

You
are an experienced Merchandiser who has strong work Ethics, can work
independently and has an eye for details. You are well organized, enjoy fast paced
work environment and love building strong business relationships. If you have
experience and enjoy working in a food store this is an advantage. You have a
smartphone and access to the internet.

Responsibilities

•
Performing merchandising tasks at one or two retail stores

•
Maintain sections including proper rotation, restocking and ensuring
distribution of all products

•
Addressing any out of stock issues

•
Planograms and schematics (POG) compliance

•
Securing additional/incremental off shelf displays

•
Cleaning our sections: Ensure that equipment always meets food safety
requirements, including cleaning, modules dewatering and sanitation

•
Replacing and/or repairing fixtures as required and placement of POP materials
including shelf tags and signage

•
Placing product orders and working with supplier to ensure the order is placed.

•
Promoting special buying opportunities, displays and new products.

•
Perform any necessary POG changes as well as making recommendations with
department on adjustments to maximize sales.

•
Building and maintaining strong relationships with department personnel and
store management.

•
Submit daily required visit reports



Qualifications and Requirements

-
Preferably be within 5 KM of the store (by car or public transport)

-
Ability to lift up to 45lbs

-
Previous merchandising experience is an asset but not a requirement

-
Able to commit to the length of the contract

-
Have a smartphone and access to the internet

Hourly
rate : $16

Job
Types: Part-time, Contract

title: Lab Patient Technician - Regular Part-time
description:
Improve lives. Love your job. Grow your career.

Do you want to help improve patients’ healthcare outcomes? Now you can. LifeLabs Medical Laboratory Services is a proud Canadian company with over 50 years experience. We provide laboratory testing services that help healthcare providers diagnose, treat, monitor and prevent disease in patients. LifeLabs is currently looking for a Lab Patient Technician to join our team in Gananoque, Ontario.

As a Lab Patient Technician you will be responsible for the specimen collection process, from greeting patients through to preparation of specimens for transportation. This is an important role in patient care and our business, and will let you see the difference that you make in patients’ lives. This is a regular part-timerole suitable for an individual with a flexible schedule, and includes the opportunity to pick up additional shifts at other LifeLabs locations.

In this role you will:
Greet and request required information from patients, explain the specimen collection process, and ensure patients have followed necessary test protocol prior to specimen collection.
Perform phlebotomies, connect/disconnect holter monitors, and perform ECG tracings.
Perform special test collections, such as medical/legal drug screens, paternity tests, and clinical trials, and complete related documentation.
Maintain client relationships, including responding to inquiries and following up on requests.
Complete data entry of required patient demographics, requisition information, and other information related to processing test results.
Prepare specimens for transportation and testing.
The right person for this role will be focused on great customer/patient service, and be able to relate to patients and clients even in stressful situations. Some key qualities include: empathy, flexibility, adaptability to change, and problem solving skills. Other requirements include
Graduate of an approved Laboratory Assistant program or equivalent.
Phlebotomy experience.
Excellent communication skills.
Good computer skills with a minimum typing speed of 40 wpm.
Ability to maintain the strictest standards of patient privacy and confidentiality.
We are looking for passionate individuals who share in the importance of our values: Caring, Customer Driven, Agile and One Team and can live these values with us every day.

Ready to make a difference? Apply today.

LifeLabs is committed to building an inclusive environment and will provide accommodations in accordance with the AODA – Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act. Please indicate in your application any accommodations you will require throughout the recruitment process. Alternatively please contact our corporate offices main line to be directed to a member of the Talent Acquisition team at (416) 675-4530.

title: Client Service Manager
description:
Client Service Manager

Reporting to the Regional Manager Client Service this position will be responsible for managing Livingston client satisfaction. The CSM will be the client’s key business contact for all lines of business, building strong relationships with financial decision makers, increasing client retention and identifying opportunities for up-selling all lines of business.

DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES
Manages client relationships: Manages all aspects of client's portfolio. This is a client facing position. Conducts client visits to understand their cross-border trade requirements. Understands client history, running appropriate reports on revenue and transactions, analyzing client information in appropriate systems (SFDC) determine strengths, weaknesses, opportunities and threats. Establishes strong relationship with clients’ financial decision-maker as their single point of contact for all lines of business.
Up-sells/Negotiations: Identifies client needs for other lines of business, reviews data, creates pricing assessment and recommendations to client.
Main contact with our clients.
EXPERIENCE NEEDED
5 years Customer Relationship Management experience in similar environment (Account Management, Relationship management).
1-2 years customs brokerage (import / export) experience
Knowledge and experience with project management methodology and techniques.
Comfortable preparing and making presentations to small and large audiences
(Preferred) Customs Brokerage License or CCS Designation

title: Project Coordinator
description:
Project Coordinator
Black & McDonald Limited - Napanee, Ontario
Posted:Friday August 25 2017

Job Description

Page Content
People:Our Strength, Our Future

A career at Black & McDonald will grant you the opportunity to contribute to our culture of continuous improvement, help reinforce our values and shape our contribution to community, and drive our continued success. Our vision is to be the best company to work for; the best company for safety, quality and value; the best company for customer service; and the best company for technical expertise.

Position Summary

Black & McDonald is actively seeking a Project Coordinator for the TransCanada Energy Ltd. Napanee Generating Station (NGS) Project located in Napanee, Ontario. The successful candidate will assist with the overall performance, including the management of costs, schedule and project status while maintaining excellent relations with the employees, subcontractors, consultants and our clients.

Duties & Responsibilities
Plan, in conjunction with the Project Manager, the execution of projects in accordance with Corporate Policy
Assist with preparing contracts
Prepare progress reports
Assist in the purchase of supplies and materials
Prepare and maintain timesheets
Document control
Fleet/equipment management
Office management
Other duties as assigned
Scheduling
Change management

Desired Skills & Experience

Job Skills
Competency Requirements
Change Orientation
Communicates Effectively
Continuous Learning
Customer Focus
Holds Self and Others Accountable
Problem Solving and Innovation
Teamwork and Collaboration
Values and Respects Others

Education & Skill Requirements
2-3 years' experience in the construction industry on electrical ICI projects
University degree in electrical engineering, college diploma in construction engineering technology, or college diploma in construction project management
Effective and efficient written and verbal communication skills
Planning, scheduling, and organizational skills

Company Description

In 1921, William J. McDonald and William R. Black formed Black & McDonald Limited,
a partnership to engage in residential wiring. Throughout the years, Black & McDonald has remained a
family-owned business with an uncompromising commitment to the founder's principles of delivery as
promised and fairness to all. The company has followed a planned course of diversification and expansion,
combining growth and financial stability with ongoing investment in our people, and a willingness to pioneer
new business opportunities and directions. Black & McDonald is an integrated, multi-trade contractor
providing electrical, mechanical, utility and maintenance services to government, industrial, commercial
and institutional markets. Currently, Black & McDonald operates across Canada, US and Bermuda.
The company has over 5,500 employees working out of a network of more than 26 offices.

Black & McDonald approaches accessibility from an inclusive perspective, and will provide reasonable accommodation upon request throughout the recruitment and selection process.

title: Multi Skilled Maintenance - Future Opportunities
description:
Our Maintenance workforce supports the tire manufacturing process in various machine operation of general laborer roles. These positions may require standing and walking on a concrete floor, working in warm temperatures with no air conditioning, doing physically demanding work in a dirty environment, working at heights of 10 feet or greater and entering confined spaces. Team or individual project work. Satisfactory completion of a probationary period and following established safety policies.

Primary responsibilities include performing maintenance and repairs on a diverse range of existing equipment to ensure optimum operating conditions and uptime. This will include performing preventative maintenance tasks and requires the ability to perform extensive troubleshooting of electronic industrial equipment. Necessary skills include knowledge of machine shop equipment, electronic industrial systems, PLCs, variable frequency drives, servo drives, power distribution, instrumentation, preventative maintenance, human machine interfaces, hydraulic, pneumatic, and mechanical systems.
The position involves being part of a team based operation that operates within a rapid rotation 12 hour shift with every other weekend off.
Job Specific Physical work capabilities exercises
Successful completion of pre-employment assessment
High school diploma or GED
Applicants must possess a current Certificate of Qualification license and related experience in one of the following:
Industrial / commercial electrician with three years of journeyman industrial experience
Mechanical / electronic / electrical technology or instrumentation technology with three years of related industrial experience
Industrial maintenance mechanic (millwright) with three years of journeyman industrial experience
Motor vehicle mechanic with three years of experience
Preference will be given to those candidates possessing:
A strong electrical background with mechanical experience.
Machine startup experience
Strong troubleshooting skills
A certificate of apprenticeship
